Zahraa is a hard worker. She paints special requested pictures and designs on house walls and mostly restaurants to add some beautiful decorations. She also draws and paints on glass. Her talent is improving through experience, and she works upon  customers' request.

Zahraa applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary painting tools and paints for her business. She helps her husband in making their living and she takes good care of her children.

Zahraa's good  reputation has helped a lot in improving her business and income. She hopes to stay recommended by her customers to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary painting tools and paints for her business

loans.name: Ogla

texts.en:
Ogla is a mother of four children and has been in farming for ten years. She says farming has been her only source of income. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.

Ogla has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic about the business growth and is focusing on having a farm of three quality dairy cows and ranking among the established dairy farmers.

She says animal diseases remain a challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia works hard to support her family. Eulalia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Eulalia has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single man who has been working in selling mobile phones, prepaid cards and accessories for six years. He is a hardworking man with a good reputation, well known in his area. 

Ali works a lot on improving and expanding his business, that's why he applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his prepaid cards capital through buying a big amount at a special discount.

This is Ali's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that through investing this loan in the proper way, he will be capable of improving and expanding his business through opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase his prepaid cards capital through buying a big amount at a special discount

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 44 years.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Fedelina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sahaya

texts.en: Sahaya is 45 years old and married with 2 children. With one child in school, Sahaya works very hard to provide for them. She runs a copra retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of copra to sell. (Copra is dried coconut meat from which coconut oil is extracted.) She has been in this business for 8 years. In the future Sahaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of copra to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amalia is 31 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.

Amalia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anacil

texts.en:
Anacil is 31 years old and has 2 children. She is married and her 2 children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Anacil would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past 7 years, she has operated a weaving business, making roofing materials from coconut leaves and selling them from her home to her customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality. She dreams of opening a kiosk.

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil to start a kiosk. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil to start a kiosk.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs and vending vegetables.

Evangeline aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 43-year-old married man, father of three children, who has been working in the upholstery business for 20 years.

Imad's business is unique these days, very rarely do people still do this kind of work, and that's why Imad has to do his best to keep his business number one, and to improve it as much as he can to keep his customers pleased.

Imad's business is known as Arabian Upholstery. He fixes wool mattresses and quilts. Imad applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary textiles, highly requested in his business.

Imad hopes that his business will continue to be recommended by his customers and will attract new customers in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary textiles for his business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 30 years old and married with 2 children.  With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliza runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 44 years old and married with 8 children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise and sell.

Adela has been buying and selling livestock for three years and also earns additional income from her general store and rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Yolanda is 57 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Yolanda has a cheese making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for cheese making.

She has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cheese making.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from her general store.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like pants, handkerchiefs, slippers and other ready to wear clothing. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like pants, handkerchiefs, slippers and other ready to wear clothing.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is single and has rice and charcoal retail businesses in the Philippines. Ailene requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Ailene is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. Anita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Anita has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Anita has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 20 years old. He has worked in the entertainment sector for two years. He has a stereo, and his customers in town call him to play music at wedding parties or any occasion that they want to celebrate.

Mahmoud needs this youth loan to buy an extra stereo and speakers, which will attract his customers. This will increase his income and allow him to educate his brother. His project is distinct because of his good performance.

loans.use: to buy an extra stereo and speakers for his business.

loans.name: Juena

texts.en:
Juena, age 37, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juena has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Juena has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Juena has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Juena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Lorna is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She would like to purchase this item because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Lorna is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing the health risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her eight children. She is married and has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Maria has requested a PHP 1,400 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She wants to purchase this stove because it enables her firewood to last longer since the stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Maria is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing the health risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is 28 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Edralyn runs a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood for her business.

Edralyn has been in this business for one year.

In the future Edralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings.

Maria Fe is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more newspapers, magazines, cooking fat, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. Merly is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using dried wood she can pick from her surroundings.

Merly is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Nelba

texts.en:
Nelba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Nelba is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Djhoanna

texts.en:
Djhoanna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Djhoanna requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Djhoanna would like to save enough money to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias has been in farming for over seven years and currently runs his farm with one farmhand and sells milk and eggs on the local market. He is married with two children aged seven and three years.

Elias has requested a loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES and expand the poultry housing unit at a cost of 60,000 KES. He plans to rear birds to the tune of four thousand within the next four years. He adds that his family life will be much better with more income from the sale of eggs.

Elias says animal diseases pose the worst threat to the farming business. He appreciates  Juhudi Kilimo loans services  with his past two loans of 30,000 KES and 60,000 KES respectively and reiterates that he will repay the  third loan on time.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 52-year-old married man with six sons. He lives in Gaza. He recently started his clothing business.

He intends to use the loan to buy shelves, a glass door, and make decorations for his new business. His personal goal is to ensure a good life for his sons' futures and increase his income.

Omar has a plan to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shelves, a glass door, and make decorations for his new business

loans.name: Hitham

texts.en:
Hitham is 23 years old, and he is from Gaza. He has a business that sells coal and plastic.  He distributes the merchandise for his customers, but he is asking Ryada for a loan to buy a cargo truck, which will improve his work and increase the number of orders.  It will also help him make faster deliveries.
 
He is trying to save his money to be able to marry and start good life with his small family. His dream is to expand his business and start another business beside that one.  Because Hitham is under 30, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a cargo truck for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a forty-two-year-old single mother of five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail shop business for four years. She started with 400,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is customers not paying on time.  Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is to own a wholesale shop. Charity wants money to buy sugar, salt, and charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en:
Buyanhishig is a 28-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia.  Her oldest child studies at the secondary school.  Her husband operates his own business.  She  started making traditional clothes in 2006. She makes the clothes in stylish designs.  She trades them at the trade centers in neighbor provinces. 

Buyanhishig is a talented woman who says that "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing the necessary materials for the business.  I am planning to increase the sales".  The total amount she is requesting is 3,500,000 Tugrik (MNT) to buy materials for traditional clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make traditional clothes

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en: Cyril is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He is a teacher by profession and has also operated a retail business for a period of eight years now.  Inadequate capital is affecting his business. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house.  Cyril wants a loan to buy sugar, salt and rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice to resell.

loans.name: Marvin Alfonso

texts.es:
El joven Marvin Alfonso esta soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación diversificada, presta servicios de contador, lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora, y poder mejorar su trabajo, espera tener un mejor empleo y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en: Marvin Alfonso is a young man, 26 years old and single. He completed secondary school and has worked as an accountant for two years, relying on the support of his family. He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy a computer to improve his work. Marvin Alfonso hopes to get a better job and to be able to continue contributing to his family.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married to Rose, and blessed with four children aged 19, 13, 9 and 5 years respectively.  He sells shoes, a business he started seven years ago, and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).  

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more shoes for sale.  The profit he earns from his business will help him invest in other businesses for additional income.  

His dream is to one day have the best shoe store in Eldoret and its environs.  This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale (both new and second-hand shoes).

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 35-year-old married man, the father of two children. He has 12 years of experience in selling coffee and juices, that's why in 2006, he opened his own shop selling espresso and juice.  His business is going on just fine; most of his customers are delighted with what he offers them.  

Walid is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new espresso machine necessary for his business. He will also use part of it to repair his house's rooftop.  

Walid started his business from a van where it used to be his coffee shop, them he expanded his business to a specialized coffee selling shop.  Today he is applying for a new espresso machine, while he hopes that in the near future he will buy a larger shop, an ice cream machine, and a smoothies machine too.

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine and to repair his home's roof

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 47-year-old married woman with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of twelve years. Her personal goals are to educate her children and to buy land to grow crops. Alice wants a loan to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 33 years old and from Olkalou.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

Lillian is a farmer and has been in this business for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan to enable her buy fertilizers, potato seeds, etc. to put into her farm. She is optimistic that her farm will do well in this planting season.

She hopes to expand her farm area in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Sugar

texts.en:
Sugar is a 20-year-old man who lives with his parents and siblings in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia.  He runs a welding service business based on his experience.  He learned welding when he was young from his father.  He is planning to open a welding center with some support.  Even though he is quite new to the business, he did some research on the field and planned all the procedures.  

Sugar is a diligent young man who says that "I would like to develop the welding business with the support of lenders by building a workplace for it".  The total amount he is requesting is 2,700,000 Tugrik (MNT) to build a workplace where he can run the business.

loans.use: To build a workplace for his business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 28-year-old married woman with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of seven years. She would like to educate her children and build a permanent house. She has business goals of setting up a piggery and poultry project to supplement her salary. Lucy wants a loan to buy iron sheets, sand, and cement for construction of her residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, sand, and cement for construction of her house.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en: Willy is a 33-year-old married man with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of seven years. He wishes to educate his children, buy a car to work as a taxi driver so as to supplement on his meager salary, and buy land for farming. Willy intends to use this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Bendiciones De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Doña esmeralda es una señora de 66 años de edad, está casada desde hace 40 años, tiene 8 hijos  todos  mayores de edad y ya se independizaron, y vive con su esposo en una colonia suburbana de Choloma Cortes.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al comercio, principalmente a la compra y venta de productos alimenticios como carnes de todo tipo y lácteos como queso, mantequilla, crema y cuajada. Este negocio lo ha mejorado con préstamos, ya tiene formada su clientela, actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo de 15,000.00 Lempiras para comprar más producto de carnes y lácteos para vender, de donde ella obtiene sus propios ingresos. Continuara esforzándose con el negocio para hacerlo crecer y tener una mejor vida familiar.

Su préstamo es grupal, el grupo se llama Bendiciones de Jesús y está formado por tres personas según la fotografía  a la izquierda se encuentra María Victoria, en medio Esmeralda y a la derecha Glenda, todas viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al negocio de confección y venta de carnes y lácteos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 66 years old, and she has been married for 40 years.  She has eight children, and they are all independent adults.  She lives with her husband in a suburban neighborhood in Choloma Cortes.

She has devoted herself to commerce for many years.  She primarily buys and sells food products like all types of meat and dairy products like cheese, butter, cream, and curds.  This business has improved with loans, and she now has an established clientele.

She is now requesting her seventh loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy more meat and dairy products to sell, which is where she gets her own income.  She will continue with her efforts with the business in order to make it grow and to have a better family life.

This is a group loan.  The group is named Bendiciones de Jesús, and it is comprised of three people.  To the left in the photograph you can see María Victoria, Esmeralda is in the middle, and Glenda is to the right.  They all live in the same community and devote themselves to the business of making and selling meat and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy more meat and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Samuel G.

texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and is married to Lydia. They have three children who are all in school. 

Samuel has a butchery shop that he has been operating for the past 17 years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy a sheep and goats to be slaughtered at his butchery.

He hopes to open a restaurant where people can come and eat roasted meat.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and goats

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 34-year-old married woman with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a stationary business in Kagadi, which she has run for a period of five years. She got start-up capital from savings, as she first worked in a hotel as a waitress. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are challenging factors affecting her business. She would like to educate her children and hire employees to help her expand her business. Grace wants a loan to buy books, pens, and reams of paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, pens, and reams of paper to sell.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a 39-year-old married woman with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of 16 years. She would like to educate her children and build a permanent house. Jolly intends to use this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a forty-two-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for thirteen years and this has enabled her to educate her children. Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather and high taxes. Personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house while her business goal is buying land to grow crops and venturing into new markets. Mary wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Premitiva

texts.en:
Premitiva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her dried fish business.

Premitiva has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Premitiva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a forty-three-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for eighteen years. He has dreams of educating his children to attain high levels of education and of buying land for farming. Albert intends to use this money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove is a 20-year-old farmer from a small village of Terjola District. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Elena, 1-year-old daughter, 7-year-old sister and grandmother (pensioner). Nove and Elena lead the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income of the family. They have a small pig farm with one pig and 5 piglets, as well as a hare farm. Nove sells piglets and young hares in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Nove requested credit for start-up of a dairy farm. He will keep the cow in a family-owned old cattle shed. Part of the dairy products he will use for his kid and sister and the rest will be sold on the local market. Nove’s grandmother will produce cheese and sell it in the village. The income of the family will increase by 150-200 Laris per month. It will mean a 30–40% increase. The family will be able to improve their living conditions and provide better care for their children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is a 30-year-old, ambitious woman with 2 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has hostels that she rents out to students and has been in business for 6 years. She started with capital obtained from her salary savings as she works as a bursar for a certain school. She says customers not paying on time are affecting the business. She would like to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. Dativa wants a loan to buy building materials to complete building a student hostel.

loans.use: to complete building a student hostel.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

In the future, Amy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 41 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is married with three children who are in school. Lydia's husband is a driver and he helps her take care of the family.

Lydia has a fruit shop where she sells fruit to her customers and also makes fresh juice for them. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy blending machines to do her work more efficiently.

She hopes to provide good education to her children and enable them to live comfortably through the profits that she gets.

loans.use: To buy blending machines.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as rice, dried fish, canned goods, etc.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice, dried fish, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Souheil

texts.en:
Souheil is a 48-year-old married man, the father of five children. 

Souheil has been working as a taxi driver since 2010. He used to be a sales director in a cosmetics company, but he took his compensation and insisted on buying a car and investing it in a taxi business. 

His work is very good during Lebanon's tourist high season, so he has to be ready for it. That's why he applied for this second loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance for his car. 

Souheil's previous loan was invested in school fees and requests, while today he will invest it in the car. He will also use part of the loan to continue building his house as much as he can.

Souheil is well known in the region for his good reputation and hard work.  He hopes to start a new cash transfer company in the future.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Lumenica

texts.en: Lumenica, married, is 34 years old and lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Lumenica owns and operates a retail business where she sells a variety of different products. She established the retail business as a way of generating extra income of 4,000 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of business for 4 years. Lumenica requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to buy more dried fish to sell. Lumenica has been a good member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Lumenica wants to make an expansion to her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring and fish vending. Gemma is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a new engine and fishnets for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to have a sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy new a engine and fishnets for her fishing business.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Caacupe es un grupo muy trabajador que tiene 17 miembros, ellas son mujeres con muchas ansias de trabajar y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma también ayudar a sus familias. Una muestra de su trabajo es que ya están en el cuarto ciclo, y desean poder seguir juntas hasta el máximo nivel del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Myrian es la presidenta, y gracias a su guía puede ayudar a sus compañeras y hacer que el grupo vaya bien. El deseo de ella es que sus compañeras mejoran sus vidas por medio de su propio esfuerzo para que de esa forma se sientan útiles. Myrian nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de lencería, en lo que le va muy bien, ya que tienen una buena clientela, y eso le ayuda apoyar a su familia con los gastos.
Solicito el crédito ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de más variedades de lencería con lo que quiere innovarse y atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Virgen de Caacupé is a communal bank, which is made up by 17 hard-working members. They are women eager to work and through their work they help each other and their families. A sample of their work is that they are already in the fourth cycle of the women’s entrepreneurs program and they want to remain together until the maximum level.

Myrian is the president  and thanks to her leadership she can help her partners and lead the group to do well. Her desire is that her colleagues improve their lives through their own efforts and in this way feel useful.

Myrian says that she makes a living selling lingerie, which is going very well, since she has a good clientele. This helps to support her family´s expenses. She requested the loan because she wants to purchase a larger variety of lingerie with that she will innovate and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie to sell

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann is 26 years old and married.

Mae Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mae Ann has been raising pigs for four years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mae Ann requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Mae Ann would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fermented shrimp (guinamos) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Estela requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more shrimp to use for making guinamos.


In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to use for guinamos.

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en:
Madina's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Madina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 3 years, Madina has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods for resale like sweet potatoes and raw matooke, and will help Madina to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Madina's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods for resale like sweet potatoes and raw matooke

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. 

She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Helen requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy styrofoam boxes for her dried fish business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy styrofoam boxes for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Gina is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Gina owns and operates a carinderia or small restaurant. Gina has been in her business for eight years and earns 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC. Gina is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. His child goes to the kindergarten. 

He started a food store business in 2007 with his wife. Now the business activities are stable. There are many regular customers who use their store since it has a variety of choices. Erdenebat spends much for the transportation of the goods, so they are planning to buy a van to bring the supplies. 

Erdenebat is a diligent man who says, "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing a van to bring the supplies." 

The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy a van to deliver his grocery products for his business.

loans.use: To buy a van to deliver his grocery products.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 50, is married and has seven children; two are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mildred has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as bread, soft-drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Mildred has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money to put up a mini grocery store at a public market.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as bread, soft-drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

NWTF is relisting Jessica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rhodally

texts.en:
Rhodally is 31 years old and married with 3 children. With all children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rhodally runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

Rhodally requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Rhodally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Abahuzakiyago Group

texts.fr:
Gervais fait partie du groupe Abahuzakiyago et   habite à Bujumbura. Il a   36 ans et est marié à Jeanine, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 3 mois à 6 ans, l’aine étudie

Il fait le commerce des chaussures   depuis 8 ans. 

Il  est à son  quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chaussures à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  faire le commerce de restaurant et des habits.
texts.en:
Gervais is a member of the Abahuzakiyago group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old and married to Jeanine, a farmer. They have three children together, ranging from three month to six years of age. The oldest child is in school. 

Gervais has been selling shoes for eight years. He is on his 14th loan with Turame. With this Kiva lona, [he] will bolster his capital and buy a lot of shoes for resale, in order to increase his revenues. In the future, he would like to start selling cooked dishes and clothing.

loans.use: to bolster his capital and buy a lot of shoes for resale, in order to increase his revenues.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru:
Чынаре 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Чынара с 1998 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Чынары на сегодняшний  день имеется 6 коров, 7 овец и 2 лошади, что приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят.  Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Chynara is 40 years old, married and bringing up four children.  The main source of income for her family is Chynara’s livestock business, which she launched in 1998 with the starting capital of 2,000 KGS. Chynara’s farm now includes six cows, seven sheep and two horses, which brings in around 10,000 KGS per month from the sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to develop her business further, Chynara applied to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS in order to buy some calves. Chynara plans to invest the resulting revenues in a further expansion of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед более пяти лет занимается изготовлением и торговлей больших металлических дверей и деревянных окон. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Он берет кредит для покупки необходимых инструментов и материалов, чтобы увеличить количество производимого товара.
texts.en: Jamshed has been selling metal doors and wooden windows for more then five years.  He is 22 years old.  He is a bachelor.  He is taking out a loan to purchase necessary tools and supplies.

loans.use: to puchase wooden boards, metal sheets and necessary tools

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 41 years old, married and the mother of six children. She lives with her family in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she earns a living by selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for 18 years, and earns PHP 13,800 a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy nets and other accessories for her boat. Emma is been a member of GDMPC for a year, and her goals for the future are to build a house and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy nets and other accessories for her boat.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She works hard to support nine children. 

Analyn requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp so she can extend her business hours past nightfall. She is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Parohat

texts.ru: Парохат жительница города Худжанд. Ей 60 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она более восьми лет занимается шитьем. В основном Парохат занимается шитьем простыней, пододеяльников, наволочек и матрасов. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Parohat is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She's 60 years old and she's married. She's been engaged in sewing for more than eight years. Parohat is mostly engaged in sewing of sheets, duvet covers, pillowcases and mattress. She is taking a loan to purchase fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for her sewing business

loans.name: Karina Adilia Karlota

texts.es:
La señora Karina Adilia Karlota esta casada, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene un hijo pequeño, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo gracias al apoyo de su madre, hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica como ayudante de camión.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y mejorar su producción de tejidos, en el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Karina Adilia Karlota is 20 years of age and married with a small child. She went to elementary school, and currently works as a weaver. She started working in this field thanks to the support of her mother, and has five years’ experience. Karina Adilia Karlota also has the support of her husband, who is a bus attendant.

She has requested this loan to purchase threads of different colors and to improve her production of fabric, and hopes to have a large business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her weaving business.

loans.name: Yuranis De Jesùs

texts.es: Yuranis de 27 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 1 hijo de 3 años y vive al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la elaboración y venta de alimentos. Su negocio lo inició hace 2 años, cuando recibió su liquidación, producto del trabajo que tenia en un almacén de la ciudad y del que debió renunciar para atender a su pequeño hija y las labores propias del hogar. Su negocio es elaborar y vender alimentos a una clientela que poco a poco ha conquistado entre vecinos de los alrededores donde habita, que son su principal mercado. Su mayor deseo es tener un restaurante bien equipado para desarrollar su actividad más cómodamente, porque en la actualidad su mayor desafío para el crecimiento de este es el poco espacio con el que cuenta. Sus compras la realiza diariamente y sus gastos de transporte incrementan el costo de sus productos por eso ella necesita comprar en mayor volumen y disminuir la frecuencia de compra para para ganar descuentos  y ser mas competitiva. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas y para reparar herramientas que no están resultando ser efectivas por su deterioro.
texts.en:
Yuranis, 27, is a married woman and has one 3-year old child.  She lives in the south of the city where she makes a living preparing and selling food.  She started her business two years ago when she received her severance pay from a job she had in a store in the city.  She had to resign to care for her little daughter and tend to the household chores. 

Her business is preparing and selling food to customers she gained little by little from neighbors in the surrounding area where she lives. This is her principal market.  Her greatest wish is to have a well-equipped restaurant to develop her business more comfortably, because her greatest challenge to growing her business is the small space she has. 

Her shopping is done daily and her transportation expenses increase the cost of her products.  For this reason she needs to buy in greater quantity and decrease the frequency of her shopping so she can qualify for volume discounts and be more competitive.  This is why she has turned to Credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy supplies for the preparation of meals and also repair the work equipment that is not working effectively because of wear.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of meals and also to repair work equipment.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica  de 22 años es una joven comerciante de productos que promociona mediante guías especializadas, negocio que inició desde hace 2 años, actividad que inició cuando una líder de una empresa importante, le consiguió obtener un pedido de mercancías variadas por valor de $160.000 COP, para pagarlo a crédito. Su perseverancia en el negocio y su disciplina de trabajo, muy pronto dieron sus frutos y su clientela empezó a crecer,  entusiasmándola aun más; así mismo su cupo de crédito en esta revista fue aumentado y por eso a su negocio le agregó el servicio de llamadas a celulares. Su meta es lograr apoyar totalmente los gastos de su familia y tener suficiente dinero para continuar sus estudios y obtener un grado en una carrera técnica que la convierta en una persona exitosa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará lociones, perfumes y cremas, para aprovechar las ofertas de la temporada y ofrecer a su clientela productos con un precio de oportunidad, que a su vez le permita  a Mónica, aumentar sus ventas,  ganar dinero e incrementar cada vez mas su capital de trabajo, con el cual empezar a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mónica, age 22, is a Young merchant who sells products that are promoted through specialized guides.  She started this business two years ago when a leader from an important business got her an order of varied merchandise for $160.00 COP to pay for on credit.

Her perseverance in the business and her work discipline very quickly gave results, and her clientele started to grow.  

This made her even more  enthusiastic.  Her credit limit in this magazine was increasing, so she added the service of cell phone calls.  

Her goals are to manage to totally cover the family’s expenses, to have enough money to continue her education, and to get a degree in a technical career that will transform her into a successful person.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy lotions, perfume, and creams in order to take advantage of the seasonal special offers.  She will offer her customers an opportune price for the products, which will allow Mónica to increase her sales, earn money, and have more and more capital.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfume, and creams.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married and has a retail business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

Carmelita is borrowing 7,500 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp for a backup light in case of emergency. She is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family in addition to saving money.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita is married and the mother of five children. She works hard to support her family by making billiard-pool tables and running a general store, She is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 through NWFT to buy more of the equipment she needs to make billiard-pool tables. Enriquita has sustained her business activities with 14 previous loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will allow her to continue saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more equipment to make billiard-pool tables.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is a 21 year-old man who lives with his wife and parents. He is a cattle breeder and has 6 years of experience in this field.  Taleh chose this particular activity because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and most of the national dishes, like dolma and pilau, are made of meat. 

Taleh usually buys small calves in the central bazaar, fattens and raises them for 5-6 months. Then he resells the grown cattle for a more profitable price to market vendors and butchers.  His father helps to look after the animals and to feed them.  He also breeds buffalo, because buffalo`s milk and yoghurt is rare product and consider as delicacy. His monthly income is 250 AZN.

Demand in fresh meat is very high and Taleh would like to cover demand of his permanent clients. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy three calves and one milk cow.  This will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milk cow

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad is a farmer and has been in active in farming for over six years. He is a 38 year-old married man and has three school-aged children. Mahammad is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He sells fruits and vegetables in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN. Mahammad asked for a loan of 600 AZN to enlarge his business. As these products are in high demand, Mahammad wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. He will buy seeds and fertilizers. This is his first loan from AqroInvest and Kiva and he hopes that this loan also will help him start a new crop.

loans.use: to expand business and buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en: Shahen is from the village of Benjamin in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married with a four-month-old son.  Shahen has a high school education and has been farming for the past twelve years.  In addition to supporting his family, he helps his relatives living nearby.  Shahen would like to grow his business.  He is looking for a loan to purchase calves and fertilizer.  He expects this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent.  He enjoys living in Benjamin where the air is fresh, nature is abundant, and his friends and relatives live nearby.  He is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase calves and fertilizer

loans.name: Togmid

texts.en:
Togmid is a 45-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. His youngest child goes to kindergarten. 

Togmid started selling secondhand shoes in 2004, and his wife assists him in the business. He has been planning to increase the types of the products he sells. When he is in town, Togmid also runs a taxi service, which he has been doing since 2010. 

Togmid is a hardworking and open man who says that he would like to expand his business activities by purchasing shoes and other supplies in large quantities. The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy shoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies for his used shoe sales business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is married and the mother of 10 children. She works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 7,500 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She will use the lamp to keep her business open after nightfall. The lamp will also lower her expenses, help the environment and reduce health hazards to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Aminovlo

texts.ru: Аминовло женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Боле 3-х лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. Он имеет богатый опыт в сфере скотоводства. Его дом находится у подножья гор и это ему помогает пасти скот. В бизнесе помогают дети и жена. Аминовло запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Aminovlo is married and raising six children. He has been engaged in buying and reselling livestock for more than three years. He has a rich experience in livestock breeding. His house is located at the foot of the mountains and this helps in feeding the cattle. The children and wife helps with the business. 

Aminovlo requests a loan for the purhcase of cattle. He hopes for your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hayit

texts.ru: Хайит женат и на воспитании имеет четверых сыновей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Он вместе с отцом работал на арендованной земле, на площади 1 гектара земли, выращивал виноград, картошку, морковь и помидоры и до сегодняшнего дня продолжает данный бизнес. Он в этом бизнесе уже более 10 лет. Недавно организовал дехканское хозяйство. Кроме этого в течении 5 лет параллельно занимается вместе с сыновьями по производству алюминиево-пластиковых окон и дверей. Хайит запрашивает займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче-смазочных материалов и оплата труда рабочей силы. А также покупки сырья. С прибыли он хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Hayit is married and raising four sons.  His wife is a homemaker.  Hayit used to work with his father growing grapes, potatoes, carrots and tomatoes
on a one-hectare leased land, and he still continues to do so today.  He has been involved in this business for more than ten years and has recently formed a dehkan farm.

Besides his farming business, and for the past five years, Hayit and his sons have been involved in the manufacturing of aluminum-plastic doors and windows.

Hayit is requesting a loan to boost his working capital and buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, lubricants and pay for labor.  With his profits, he wants to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and has a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Emma has been in this business for 14 years now.

Emma requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vegetables and spices to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She has borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF, and has been running her general store for five years. She also earns money on the side by selling coconut wine. Her goal for the future is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 55 years old and married with nine children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Letecia has previously borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru: Илёс добрый и трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 9 лет он занимается откормом мелкого рогатого скота, а также выращиванием картошки и пшеницы. В бизнесе помогает жена. На полученную прибыль Илёс хочет провести свадьбу своего брата. Илёс запрашивает займ для покупки ядохимикатов, семян картошки и покупки скота. Илёс надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ilyos is a kind and hardworking person. He's married and raising two children.  Ilyos has been herding sheep and raising sheep and goats for more than 9 years. He also grows potatoes and wheat. His wife helps him in his business. Ilyos used some of his revenues to pay for his brother’s wedding. Ilyos plans to use his loan to buy pesticides, potatoes seeds and buying cattle. Ilyos is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, pesticides and cattle

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. 

Lilia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her ducks. She has been raising ducks for ten years and earns additional income from charcoal retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 34 years old. She is married and lives in the village with her family: her husband, Alexander; her mother-in law, and her two children (7 and 11 years old). Both of them go to school. 

The family earns their living through trading and agriculture. Naira has a grocery store and her husband is a farmer. Alexander has 1 hectare of land. He grows fruits peaches and strawberries, and also he planted a vineyard on 0.1 hectare of land. The family sells products locally. They work hard and their total average monthly income is 1,000 GEL.

Naira requested a loan to increase the stock in the store. She hopes that the loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. With the loan, the average income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to expand the store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 55 years old and married with 12 children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a rice grains business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase rice to sell.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice grain for sale.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en: Lovelyn is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lovelyn is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Lovelyn has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Luz has been in this business for five years. Luz earns more income from fish vending.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her 13 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to extend her business hours to be open after nightfall.

Merlinda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 52 years old, married, and has five children. Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She sells feeds in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more feeds to sell.

Rosario has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more feeds to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell

loans.name: Noshaba's Group

texts.en:
Noshaba is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom attend school. Noshaba and her husband are both highly qualified parents. 

Noshaba runs a sewing center where she teaches the neighborhood girls sewing skills and also sews clothes for her customers. Her husband runs a school where he teaches the neighborhood kids.He has a Master's degree and teaches the children to use their talents so that they will have bright futures.

Noshaba has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing center business. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine and thread to improve her business. She is confident that this loan will help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Nerguimaa

texts.en: Nerguimaa is a 37-year-old widowed woman who lives with her two children in Govisumber province, Mongolia. Her children study at the secondary school. Since her husband died, she has become responsible for the children. She started renting a shop counter and selling garments for babies and kids. It has been eight years since she started her business. Her business activities are stable. She has been trying really hard to feed her family and be successful. Nerguimaa is a diligent, active, and responsible woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing some garments from China. I am planning to buy them in wholesale and trade them in for good prices." The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy more garments from Beijing.

loans.use: To buy more garments from Beijing

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for ten years. She sells a variety of items, such as sugar, milk, coffee, and canned goods. 

Virginia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Najmi

texts.ru: Нажми - женщина 60-ти лет, мать пятерых взрослых детей. Она уже несколько лет занимается продажей растительного масло и говяжьего жира в розницу.Хотя она уже в возрасте,она не хочет бросать свой бизнес. Её торговая точка расположена в центре продуктового рынка, поэтому её торговля в разгаре, и доход стабильный. На следующий кредит она хочет закупить по оптовой цене растительный маргарин.
texts.en: Najmi is a 60-year old woman, the mother of five grown children. For several years, she has been selling vegetable oil and beef fat.  In spite of her age, she does not want to abandon her business. Her stand is in the middle of the food market, which is why always has customers, and her income is stable. She would like to use her next loan in order to buy vegetable margarine wholesale.

loans.use: to buy vegetable margarine wholesale and expand her business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда- женщина в возрасте 39 лет, мать троих детей, занимается продажей детской одежды.Она привозит товар из Истаравшана, раз в месяц. Мавчуда из прибыли своего бизнеса смогла оплатить договор учёбы своей дочери, которая поступила в прошлом году в Вуз.Как говорит Мавчуда за пять лет кредитования в организации она смогла увеличить свой товарооборот и улучшить социальное положение семьи.На получаемый кредит Мавчуда хочет привезти летний ассортимент детской одежды.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a 39-year old woman, the mother of three. She sells children’s clothing. She brings goods from Istaravshan once a month. Thanks to income from her business, Mavjuda has been able to pay the tuition for her daughter, who has been admitted to college last year. As Mavjuda says, during five years of receiving loans she has been able to increase her sales volume and improve the social situation of her family. Mavjuda would like to use this loan to buy a selection of summer clothing for children.

loans.use: purchase of children's shirts and T-shirts

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом  молодая,умная и красивая женщина. Она замужем  и на воспитании имеет троих детей.У нее высшее образование и она некоторое время работала на фабрике. На данный момент она на декретном отпуске,а ее муж работает таксистом.Кроме этого они еще  дома откармливают скот и этот бизнес дает им хороший доход.Гуландом  хочет купить кухонный гарнитур  и она первый раз обратилась В организацию "Арванд".Гуландом надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulandom is a young, smart and beautiful woman, married to Behzod and raising three children. She has higher education and worked at the factory. Currently she is on maternity leave. Her husband works as a taxi driver, yet they also fatten cattle at home, and this business gives them a good income. 

Gulandom wants to buy kitchen furniture, and she for the first time turned the organization "Arvand". She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen furniture

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is into gari production.  Gari is made out of cassava.  Ekua sells her gari at Benyadzi, which is near Elmina. She has been doing this for three years now. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their home and utility bills. Ekua will use her loan to purchase cassava to make her gari to sell. With her profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cassava for food production

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. Margie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.
Margie is borrowing PHP 7,500 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.
She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.
Margie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment, and she is reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife and son in Selenge province, Northern Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, and his son is a student.

Erdenetsogt has been running a taxi service since 2000. He owns a small van, and his business activities have become stable. He has gained many regular customers. However, due to the unpaved roads in the countryside, his van's motor has broken down and needs to be repaired. 

Erdenetsogt is an active man who says that he would like to expand his business activities by having his motor repaired. The total amount he is requesting is 600,000 MNT.

loans.use: to replace the motor in his van.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 20 years old and lives in Gaza with his parents, who depend on him financially.

He started work on his own farm recently; he raises and sells sheep and sheep products. His dream is to enlarge his business. He needs this youth loan to cover costs, so he asked Ryada for funds to build an additional enclosure for his sheep. He will be able to gain income and ensure economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to cover costs for his sheep raising business.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is a retailer from Yerevan. She runs a shop where she trades with food. Veronika started her business several years ago to have a stable and independent source of income. 

As an entrepreneur, Veronika has slowly developed her business, and now she wants to expand it. Veronika has applied for this loan to purchase food. This loan will help Veronika to increase her sales, which will allow her to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to pay for food.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 27 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items, such as sardines, sugar, eggs, and biscuits. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now, and she works hard to support her family.

Marilyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her production business, which sells dry food like beans and groundnuts. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beans and peanuts for sale and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Beatrice's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Enkhtur is a 28-year-old married guy, father of two children, who lives with his family in the outer ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of the city, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He started his cell phone repair business in 2009. 

Besides cell phone repair he sells cell phone cases and other accessories. He is requesting a 1,200,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase tools and other cell phone repair tools to sell and to enlarge his current rental stall.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone repair tools and expand his current rental stall

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa extracts and sells palm kennel oil at Benyadzi near Elmina. Adjoa is married with five children. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband and to feed and clothe their children. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase more palm kennels to extract oil for sale. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine to extract her oil.

loans.use: to purchase more palm kennels to extract oil for sale

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby is married to a farmer and has three children. They live together at Benyadzi near Elmina. For two years, Baby has sold sugar and groundnuts. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Baby will use her loan to purchase bags of sugar and groundnuts to sell. With the profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 54 years old and married with three children. For six years, she has earned a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Estrelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 23 years old and single, and she works hard to provide for her family. For two years, she has been running a spice retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a sari-sari store. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Angie has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is a 37 years old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her children study at the secondary school and her husband is unemployed. She started a food store business in 2010. Previously, she had the experience of running a vegetable retail business for 8 years. 

The business income is stable and Sarantuya has gained many regular customers. She purchases her store supplies wholesale. Sarantuya is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing the supplies in large quantities. I am planning to save for my family". The total amount she is requesting is 2,300,000 MNT to buy food supplies.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
