Efua lives together with her husband, a carpenter, and 4 children at Benyadzi. She extracts palm kernel oil to sell at Benyadzi near Elmiina. She uses her income to support the husband in feeding and clothing their children. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase more palm kernel to extract the oil to sell. With the new profits she wishes to buy a machine to extract the palm oil.

loans.use: to purchase more palm kernel to extract oil to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 43-year-old married woman who has 6 children, aged between 13 and 22 years. Her husband works as a fisherman and carpenter.

Leonila is involved in seaweed farming. She is able to help provide for her family’s basic needs with her earnings. She also runs a small sari-sari store. Leonila hopes to earn better and to be able to sustain her children’s education. She has requested a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. She says she always prays to have good health so she can take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macroni, meat and fish stew. Beatrice has been selling waakye for 3 years now. She is married. Her husband is a farmer.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. 

Beatrice needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of waakye to sell. With the new profits, Beatrice will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredient for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her mother and 5 children in Arhangai province, Central Mongolia. Three of her children study at college while the others stay at home. 

Batsuuri started a hand made souvenir production business in 2007.  Because the area where she lives attracts many tourists, there is a large demand for souvenirs. She needs some support to keep her business activities stable and profitable.  Batsuuri is a talented woman who says "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing the materials wholesale. I am planning to create many souvenirs in large amounts.”  The amount she is requesting to buy souvenir production materials is 700,000 MNT .

loans.use: to buy souvenir production materials.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and add more stock in his shop. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to own another business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 40, has been running a transportation business for over 12 years in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his 3 children all together in a ger /a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt. Two of the children attend secondary school).

Mr. Bayarsaikhan has a plan to have own new house for his family’s good living conditions in the future. He owns a small plot of land in the boundary district of the city. According to his plans, his new house will be built on his plot of land in the next year. At first, he needs to prepare the place of his house building. Currently there are too many rocks and stones in the ground on his plot of land. He is requesting a loan that will be dedicated to finance the cleaning up of the ground of stones and to flatten his plot of land to prepare for the house building.

loans.use: to clean and flatten the stones out the ground of his plot of land for the house building.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and his mother in Bayanhongor province. He has been running a smithery since 1995, and his wife helps with the business. The smithery is stable, and they have been improving their standard of living.

Jargal is planning to develop his business through financial support. Jargal is a diligent and active man who says, "my equipment is getting old, so I would like to buy some necessary new equipment and materials to make silver jewelry." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy equipment and materials for smithery.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials for smithery.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a food vendor. She sells rice porridge and bread at Benyadzi, near Elmina. She is married to a fisherman and they have 4 children. Nana  has been selling rice porridge for 11 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing her children and to pay for school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare porridge and bread to sell. With the new profits, Nana will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde, vive al lado de su esposa y su pequeña hija la cual tiene 6 años de edad, es el regalo más grande que Dios le ha dado nos comenta y por ella el daría la vida al igual que su esposa; Aníbal es un hombre que siempre busca la manera de dar lo mejor de si por sacar adelante a su familia, el tiene el apoyo incondicional de su esposa que quien lo anima y quien también trabaja muy duro para tener un dinerito mas para los gastos; la vivienda de anibal se encuentra en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas bonitas un clima maravilloso y por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón y plátano. Con mucho esfuerzo Anibal sale a trabajar diariamente en su negocio como maestro constructor desde hace ya 10 años, cuando su hija era un poco más pequeña se dedicaba a sus labores como ama de casa, pero ahora tambien trabaja en una fábrica en horas de la tarde, por ello Anibal trabaja en las mañanas y su esposa en las tardes para poder cuidar bien de su hija; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable con su trabajo y cumplido con los clientes  y sobre todo porque realiza su trabajo con gusto.

Anibal está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda, en especial construir las paredes de su vivienda, ya que su vivienda es pre-fabricada y ; con esta mejora podrá ir mejorando si vivienda y darle una buena calidad a su familia, así el seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hija y terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Aníbal is a very hardworking, humble man living with his wife and daughter who is six years old and is the greatest gift God could have given him.  He comments that he and his wife would give their lives for her.

Aníbal is a man who always seeks ways to give his best to move his family forward.  He has his wife’s unconditional support; she encourages him and also works very hard to earn a little extra money for expenses.

Aníbal’s house is in the city of Imperial which is noted for having beautiful beaches, a marvelous climate and for its agriculture, especially cotton and banana growing.  

With much effort, Aníbal goes out daily to work as a master builder; he has ten years’ experience.  When his daughter was a little younger, his wife worked being a housewife but now she also works in a factory in the afternoon which is why Aníbal works mornings while his wife works afternoons so that they can care for their daughter properly.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very responsible with his work and meets his customers’ expectations; above all because he does his work with joy.

Aníbal is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to do some home improvements.  He will do some strengthening since his house is prefabricated and he’s building the walls in stages.  With this improvement he will be able to continue improving the house and give his family a good quality of life continuing to work each day towards making his greatest dream a reality: to give his daughter a good education and to finish building his house.

loans.use: to build walls for his home

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is widowed and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods for resale, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big restaurant. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 7 years, Joel has been working hard to manage his salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand his business, Joel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more braids and hair shavers, and it will help Joel to generate greater profits and expand his business. Joel hopes that in the future he will be able to become rich in town. 

Joel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more braids and hair shavers.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is thirty-two years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is widowed and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past twelve years, Maimuna has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Maimuna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Maimuna to generate greater profits and educate her children. Maimuna hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Maimuna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maimuna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhjargal is a 54-year-old widower who lives with his son, Amartuvshin, a 21-year-old university student, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Enkhjargal is a pensioner, but he runs a taxi business, earning some money on top of his pension. Two years ago, Enkhjargal started an extension to his house, but it is not complete yet. He is planning to complete the building work by laying insulation and bricks and by replacing the coal-fired heating stove with a low-pressure central heating system, which reduces the emission of poisonous smoke into the air and saves on heating costs. (Ulaanbaatar's air quality is at a dangerous level; it is the one of the biggest problems faced by the Mongolian government at the moment.) 

At this time, Enkhjargal is requesting a loan to buy the building materials to complete the work on his house.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to complete his house building.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is single and has 5 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his video library, which sells movies and DVDs. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more movies and DVDs for hiring and resale, and it will help Peter to generate greater profits and boost his business. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to move to the higher level. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more movies and DVDs for hiring and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix his bakery's roof.

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es: Nuria de 34 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 8 años de edad,  en Puerto Colombia, municipio ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe. Allí tiene un café internet,  desde hace 7 años, en el dispone de 6 computadores una impresora multifuncional una fotocopiadora , activos con los cuales ofrece sus servicios en un local ubicado al lado de su residencia y con ello simultáneamente puede estar muy cerca dirigiendo la educación, cuidando a su pequeño hijo y realizando las tareas propias del hogar. Su esposo es un trabajador de una empresa de encomiendas y con ello aprovecharan para acceder a la franquicia de otro punto de esta empresa, para que Nuria apoye la tarea simultáneamente en su café internet. Sus planes están en hacer adecuaciones locativas, que le permitan fortalecer la seguridad,  que requiere esta negociación, si ella se concreta.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace Nuria a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él se propone, comprar un nuevo computador un multimueble de madera para organizar los equipos y un aire acondicionado para ofrecer un ambiente confortable a su clientela y trabajar ella también en un clima apropiado, pues por encontrarse a orillas del mar el calor muchas veces se torna  insoportable para el ejercicio de su tarea diaria.
texts.en:
Nuria, 34, lives with her husband and 8 year old child in Puerto Colombia, a town located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea.  She has had an Internet Café there for the last 7 years where she has six computers, a multifunctional printer and a photocopier, assets with which she offers her services in a locale next door to her house so that she can simultaneously be nearby directing the education and care of her small son while also doing her housework.  

Her husband works for a shipping firm and they will take advantage of this to open a franchise of this same firm that Nuria can run alongside her Internet café.  Her plan is to make some physical improvements that will allow for more security that this business negotiation requires if it is to come about.

She is applying for her a Kiva loan, Nuria’s first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she plans to use to buy a new computer, a wooden desk unit to organize the equipment and an air conditioner to offer a comfortable environment to her customers and also so that she can work in an appropriate environment because being located on the shore sometimes the heat becomes unbearable to do her daily tasks.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a desk unit and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Byambatogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Byambatogtokh, 29, runs a taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business since 2007, and once he changed his car to a better one. His business is a main income source of his family these days. Before, he used to work as a cook, but his salary did not usually meet his family’s necessities. Now he lives with his wife and his three children in his small, old house, which is in the slum district of the city. 

His wife Bolormaa, 31, is unemployed but she is planning to start a new business such as a cafeteria near their home. Byambatogtokh has experience in this kind of business. They are planning to run their business in a rental house, so that Byambatogtokh needs 1,500,000 MNT to cover the rental payment of their cafeteria house at first.

loans.use: to cover the payment for a rental house for a cafeteria business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 52 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his poultry business, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feeds, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger business. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feeds

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 48 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children of whom currently are not in school. For the past 4 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her small business which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel  de 51 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 29 años. Él tiene un negocio de venta de productos agrícolas y pescados que adquiere en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, de donde es oriundo y los vende a comerciantes detallistas, revendedores, tiendas del sector  y reparte en una carretilla en los barrios vecinos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio comprando cosechas completas, para convertirse en el mayor distribuidos de su departamento. Sus principales desafíos son la estacionalidad de su negocio y que ante la creciente demanda,  su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará aguacates, cerdo, ñame, pescado, suero, queso, zapote. Su razón de éxito es que con esta inversión logrará ampliar su oferta de productos, combatiendo un poco su estacionalidad y también tendrá un capital de trabajo importante,  con el cual aprovechar la época de cosecha, comprar a mejores precios y vender en mayor volumen.
texts.en: Manuel, who is 51 years old, lives in the town of Soledad with his spouse and his three children aged 23 to 29. He trades in produce and fish, which he buys in the town of San Jacinto in the district of Bolívar, where he comes from. He sells them to shops, retailers and grocery stores of the area and he distributes them in a cart to neighbourhoods in the area. His goal is to make his business grow by buying whole harvests at a time, in order to become one of the major distributors in his district. The main challenges he faces are the seasonal nature of his trade and the fact that his working capital is not enough to meet growing demand. This is why he asks for a Kiva loan, which is his first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy avocadoes, pig meat, yam, fish, whey, cheese, and sapodilla plum. He is confident he will succeed because this investment will enable him to offer a wider range of products and thus be less dependent on the seasonal nature of his trade. He will have an important working capital and will be able to take advantage of harvesting time to buy for better prices and sell in greater quantities.

loans.use: to buy avocadoes, pig meat, yam, fish, whey, cheese, and sapodilla plum.

loans.name: Otgonbat

texts.en:
Otgonbat is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her daughter studies at the secondary school. 

Using her business skills, Otgonbat started a garment retail business in 2007. Now her business activity and income are stable and improving steadily. Otgonbat is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing supplies in large quantities." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: to buy garments for sale.

loans.name: Zein El Abdin

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 27 years. He is married and lives with six family members.

Zein has been an owner for a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fishes and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a “youth loan” in order to purchase a large electrical generator and to add more food items to his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large electrical generator and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them to sell. Efua has been selling smoked fish for 6 years now. She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in the feeding and clothing of their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. Efua will expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and offer for sale.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 30 year old farmer from a small village in Baghdati District. He lives with his parents and an elder brother. Currently the only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Gocha’s parents produce cheese and sell, on average, 50 kg of this product in the village. The family also has a 1.5 hectare plot of land where maize is grown. Gocha sells harvested corn on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Gocha has requested credit for renting a tractor to till the land on the plot. Also, he will use about the half of the credit for fixing his own old truck. Gocha used to use his truck for transportation of various goods, but recently the truck has been out of order and now it has stopped working. As soon as Gocha can repair it, he’ll be able to continue transportation services. The income of the family, therefore, will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and to fix the truck.

loans.name: Mouayed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has two children.

Mouayed has owned a shop since 2000, selling shoes for women, men and kids. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
 
He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 27 years old, single and he lives with three family members, one of whom is working.

Hussein has been a tailor since 2006. He makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400, as “youth loan”, to purchase a tailoring machine and to install more shelves in his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring machine and to install more shelves in his workshop.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 43 años y junto con su esposo Jesús se dedican desde hace más de 15 años a producir café. En un principio trabajaban para otras personas y allí fue donde aprendieron lo necesario y reunieron el dinero suficiente para poder comprar un terreno y comenzar sembrar y cosechar su propio café. Ellos tienen 3 hijos los cuales les ayudan también en las fincas. Como la situación económica de la región en donde viven es algo difícil, el esposo de Teresa trabaja en ocasiones para otras personas para así tener un ingreso extra para la familia. Actualmente Teresa tiene una producción de 2 toneladas anuales, sin embargo sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación puede llegar a producir en 3 años un total de 5 toneladas y por eso necesita de un crédito pues tiene que comprar planta de café y abono, ya que muchas de las plantas que tiene ya son viejas y no tienen un buen rendimiento. A Teresa y a su esposo les gustaría que en un futuro sus hijos pudieran estudiar una carrera universitaria, ya que por las condiciones económicas que ellos vivieron de jóvenes no tuvieron esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Teresa, 43, lives with her husband, Jesús.  They’ve been coffee growers for more than 15 years.  At the beginning they worked for others and that’s how they learned what was necessary and saved up enough money to buy a piece of land and start to plant and harvest their own coffee. They have three children who also help them in the farm.  Because the economic situation in the region where they live is a bit difficult, Teresa’s husband works occasionally for others in order to earn extra family income.  

Currently, Teresa produces two tons annually.  However, she knows that with effort and dedication in three years she can reach a total production of five tons and this is why she needs a loan because she needs to buy coffee plants and manure because many of the plant she now has are old and don’t produce good yields anymore.

Teresa and her husband would like their children to study professional careers in the future since they themselves were unable to have this opportunity when they were young because of economic reasons.

loans.use: to buy coffe plants and manure.

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
Odsuren is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife operates a sewing business and his children study at the secondary school. 

Odsuren has some experience running a tire service business. Based on his experience, he is planning to restart this type of business and needs some assistance. Odsuren is a hardworking and gentle man who says, "I would like to develop the business by purchasing some tire service repair equipment. I am trying hard to feed my family."  The total amount he is requesting to buy the necessary equipment for his tire repair center is 1,500,000 MNT.

loans.use: to buy needed equipment for his tire repair center.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more motor tires for resale, and will help Richard to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger business. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more motor tires for resale.

loans.name: Elcida Maria

texts.es: Elcida de 48 años vive en el municipio e Malambo, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar, que las familias compran al detalle diariamente. Esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 14 años, cuando vendiendo fritos y almuerzos, para apoyar a su cónyuge, fue adicionando poco a poco, dos años después,  la infraestructura de tienda, teniendo en cuenta las necesidades del barrio. Ella inició su negocio, con un enfriador prestado y con crédito en un depósito y poco a poco lo fue fortaleciendo con 9 financiamientos, que realizó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización, con la cual dio mas forma a su negocio, pues aumentó el surtido de manera permanente y compró su propio enfriador. Su mayor desafío se presentó, cuando empezó a dar crédito a su clientela para ganársela y algunos se quedaron con su dinero, porque no pagaron, lo cual afectó su liquidez, pero esta experiencia le sirvió, porque la llevó a ser más cuidadosa en el manejo de sus ventas a crédito. Con su credikiva, décimo financiamiento que hace a la FMSD, comprará en mayor cantidad, ranchos, víveres, abarrotes y bebidas, con esta inversión tendrá éxito porque ganará descuentos, por compras en más volumen y de contado y porque podrá ofrecer a sus clientes precios más competitivos. Con el apoyo de la FMSD ha logrado construir su historial crediticio, que es su mejor carta de presentación, formalizar su negocio ante la Cámara de Comercio de la ciudad, así como también ha podido lograr una buena educación para sus hijos y esto es lo que la hace muy feliz.
texts.en:
Elcida, 48, lives in the town of Malambo located 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She sells snacks, groceries, soft-drinks and other basic staple items that families buy at retail daily.  She’s been in this activity for 14 years having started out selling fried snacks and lunches to help her husband and gradually added other things.  

Two years later she opened the store taking in to account the neighborhood’s needs.  She started her business with a borrowed cooler and credit on a deposit and gradually strengthened it with nine loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo an organization with which she gave her business still more structure because she permanently increased her stock inventory and bought her own cooler.  

Her greatest challenge was when she started to extend credit in order to win over customers and she lost her money because some of them didn’t pay her back which affected her liquidity.  But this experience was useful because it led her to be more careful with her management of credit accounts.

With her Kiva loan, her 10th FMSD loan, she will buy snacks, groceries, foodstuffs and beverages in larger amounts.  She will be successful with this investment because she will attain discounts for buying in volume and for paying cash and will thus be able to offer customers more competitive prices.

With help from FMSD she’s managed to build up her credit history which is her best letter of introduction, to formalize her business in the city’s Chamber of Commerce as well as attaining a good education for her children which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Soyolmaa

texts.en:
Soyolmaa is 49 and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2005, she has managed a food sales business. Soyolmaa’s husband supports her business every day. Their daughter is going to enter university this year, but there is a financial problem with the university payment.

This time she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of a car for her business. That car will be used for carrying the groceries from her supplier. She thinks it will be very helpful and beneficial for her business in the future, as well as for her husband, Purevdorj, who will run a taxi during the nights.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a car for her business.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 29 years old. He lives in Terjola District, West Georgia with his elder brother. The only source of income for the brothers is agriculture. They have a dairy farm with three milk cows. Gela produces cheese and sells it on the local market. 

Along with the above mentioned, Gela and his brother grow maize on a family-owned plot of land. They work hard, especially in spring and summer seasons, on their cornfield as well as on their dairy farm, to get a good harvest and sell it at a convenient price. Income from sales is the only source of living for them. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Gela requested credit for renting a tractor and purchasing fuel for it. He will till the land and sow maize. Afterwards, the brothers will work hard to get a good harvest and sell it on the local open market.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fuel.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 48, makes shoes in the ground floor of her building and sells them to customers. She has been running her business since 1997, and she has gained a lot of experience in her business. Initially she started her business with just 200,000 MNT. Now she has three employees and everyone’s salary is determined by their output. 

It costs about 5,000 MNT to make one pair of shoes. Currently, she has two big consumers, and there is a big enough market place for supplying the shoes. 

The loan will be used to renovate her workshop to improve her current working conditions. She also needs money to buy raw materials and equipment to increase her output.

loans.use: to renovate her workshop and buy supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 50 years old, a widower and she has three children.

Hanaa has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase a large fridge and to add more food items. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase large fridge and to add more food items.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, single and lives with two family members.

Raed has owned a store since 2004, selling spare parts for cars. He has sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He has applied for a $1200 loan in order to paint his store and to add more shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint his store and to add more shelves.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
Lusik sells clothes in Vanadzor city. She has been running her business for about 15 years. Trading allows Lusik to provide income for her family. Her husband helped her in trading. After his death, Lusik was left alone, but she is not discouraged. Lusik is 49 years old. She is a widow and lives with her son in Vanadzor city. Her son works in security and he helps his mother in business every weekend: he goes with her to Yerevan to purchase merchandise. 

Lusik sells women’s clothes and men’s sweaters and T-shirts at her shop. She buys merchandise from wholesale trade markets in Yerevan and she imports clothes from neighbouring countries as well. Lusik needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy summer season dresses, skirts, chemises, blouses and men’s T-shirts to resell. 

This is Lusik’s 3rd loan from Nor Horizon and she always makes her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy summer season dresses, skirts, chemises, blouses and men’s T-shirts from a neighbouring country to resell.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Rose is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her hotel, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh food for the hotel, like Irish potatoes and matooke (steamed plantain). This will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh food for the hotel, like Irish potatoes and matooke.

loans.name: Viviana Paola

texts.es: Viviana de 29  años vive en Guayaquil. Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio que  es la venta de ropa comenzó en su casa a vender en su casa ahora lo hace por las calles . Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola  es soltera. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener a su familia unida . Con el préstamo comprara (mercadería como ropa)
texts.en: Viviana is 29 years old, and she lives in Guayaquil. She decided to start a clothes selling activity because this is a good way to earn the money she needs to provide for her children and to pay for their necessities. She has started by selling clothes in her house, and now she works as a street vendor. She likes her job and she thanks God because things are going well. She is single and she works alone every days; crime in the area is the challenge she has to face. In the future she hopes to own a big shop and to keep her family together. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Mithar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children.

Mithar has owned a store since 2005, selling and repairing electronics supplies. He has sufficient experience in this field, as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a 3,000 USD loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Akousua

texts.en:
Akousua is married and has four children. For three years, she has produced fanti kenkey for sale. She is pictured here beside the dough and leaves she uses in producing her kenkey. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children and pay their school fees. 

Akousaua will use the loan to purchase bags of maize, leaves, and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale. With the profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Santos Margarita esta casada, tiene  54 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio de ropa, inició  dicho negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de ropa y para su posterior venta, compra de playeras, pantalones, suéteres, camisas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero y estable.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita, 54, is married.  She completed the six years of elementary education.  She has four children attending school.  She is a clothes merchant.  She started said business on her own initiative and to date has five years’ experience.

She’s asking for a loan to buy clothes for subsequent resale, to buy t-shirts, pants, sweaters, shirts, etc.  She hopes in the future to have a prosperous, stable business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jose Jonathan

texts.es:
José Salazar es un joven Guayaco emprendedor. Tiene 23 años y ya termino sus estudios superiores. Es soltero vive con sus padres y está estudiando la universidad.
El negocio en un inicio era de su mamá, desde pequeño le ayudaba en la atención del bazar. Hace unos años ella consiguió un buen trabajo por lo que le cedió la responsabilidad del negocio a él. Le gusta ya que puede manejar sus horarios para el estudio. El bazar lo atiende el solo aunque en sus días libres su mamá le ayuda. En su barrio no tiene mayor dificultad lo único es que en la temporada de vacaciones sus ventas bajan un poco. El préstamo lo requiere para surtir el negocio por las clases comprando cuadernos, lápices, laminas, cartulinas etc. Su sueño es terminar de construir la casa de sus padres, casarse tener hijos y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
José Salazar is a young entrepreneur from Guayaquil.  He is 23 years old and has completed high school.  He is single, lives with his parents, and is studying at the university.  Originally, his business was his mother's.  Since he was small, he has helped her with the stationery bazaar.  A while back, she was able to get a good job, so she passed the responsibility of the business on to him.  He likes this, since he can manage his hours for studying.

He runs the shop by himself, although his mother helps on the days she has free.  In his neighborhood he doesn't have major challenges, although during the vacation season, sales are a little slower.  He requires the loan in order to restock his business for classes buying notebooks, pencils,  laminated study sheets, and stationary, as well as other items for the shop.  His dream is to finish the construction of his parents' house, get married, have children and finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, folders, and pencils

loans.name: Elsa Isabel

texts.es: Elsa nació hace 40 años en Guayaquil. Está casada con Nixon quien es guardia de seguridad desde hace 6 años. Tiene 2 hombrecitos, como les dice ella de cariño a sus hijos, uno de 14 años que asiste al colegio y el menor tiene 2 años a quien cuida. Su negocio lo empezó hace 3 años cuando una amiga le recomendó que vendiera yambal, pero ella prefirió vender L`bel ya que le genera mayor rentabilidad. Elsa trabaja desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, tiene ese horario para poder estar en casa al regreso de su hijo. Nos cuenta que su principal preocupación son los ladrones ya que tiene que trasladar la mercadería con ella que se moviliza de un lugar a otro ofertando sus productos. Con el crédito Elsa comprara mercadería como son: maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, polvos etc., para aumentar sus ventas y seguir apoyando a su esposo en su economía.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and was born in Guayaquil.  She is married to Nixon, who has worked as a security guard for six years.  Elsa has two "little guys", what she affectionately calls her sons.  One is 14 years old and attends high school.  The other is two years old and is looked after by Elsa.  

Her business started three years ago when a friend recommended that she sells Yanbal products.  However, she prefers to sell L'Bel products since they tend to be more profitable.  Elsa works from 10am to 3pm.  She maintains this schedule so that she can be at home when her son returns from school.  Her main concern is dealing with robbers since she must carry merchandise with her as she travels from place to place in order to offer her products.  

With this loan, Elsa will buy merchandise such as makeup, perfumes, crèmes, powders, and other items so that she can increase her sales and continue helping her husband with the finances.

loans.use: to buy makeup, crèmes, perfumes, powders, and other items.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa es una mujer de 49 años. Vive en Duran que pertenece a Guayaquil. Su negocio de venta de frutas lo inicio cuando quedo viuda en vista de que necesitaba cubrir sus gastos de alimentación. Nos cuenta que gracias a Dios sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. El trabajo lo realiza sola todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Su decisión de realizar esta labor fue muy acertada ya que con ella pudo darles la educación a sus hijos. Con el crédito piensa comprar mercaderías como manzana, peras, uvas para aumentar sus ventas. Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 49-year-old woman.  She lives in Duran, which is part of Guayaquil.  Her business of selling fruit started when she became a widow because she needed to cover her food expenses.  Tomasa says that she thanks God that her children are now grown and independent.  She works by herself every day between the hours of 8am and 5pm.  Her decision to perform this type of work was very successful because she was able to provide her children with an education.  

With this loan, she plans to buy merchandise, such as apples, pears and grapes, to increase her sales.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase apples, pears, and grapes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 59-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife. He’s the one covering their heavy life expenses. Mohammad has been working as a private driver at a local company since the year 2000. 

Due to lack of financial resources, Mohammad decided to request a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l in order to rent a car, where he can work in his free time and transport his own customers. This will increase his income and therefore enhance his way of living. In the future, he plans to focus on one job and better develop his business.

loans.use: to rent a car

loans.name: Fulton

texts.es: Fulton de 56 años de edad vive en el centro de la ciudad con su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 13 a 22 años.  Allí tienen un negocio a través del cual fabrica calzado y también vende a su clientela mercancía variada de acuerdo a cada temporada y mediante pequeños financiamientos que les ofrece a sus más fieles compradores.  Inicialmente se dedicaba a la herrería, oficio aprendido por tradición familiar, pero este negocio se fue deteriorando y debió cambiar de actividad y ejercer esta tarea ocasionalmente cuando un cliente requiere rejas para puertas o para ventanas, porque lo tiene ahora orientado a la decoración. En el año 2006 su esposa realizó un curso con el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA”, e inició con la fabricación de sandalias femeninas, en la que poco a poco estaba posicionándose entre vecinos, familiares que le presentaban referidos, como ella no tenia el suficiente capital de trabajo para responde a su clientela y crecer aun más, le propuso a Fulton asociarse y el invirtió su capital, porque vio que este negocio era mas rentable que el de herrería; ellos iniciaron juntos su aventura de captar el mercado de vendedores de pequeños comerciantes de la ciudades de Barranquilla y  también de Cartagena, como hasta hoy lo hacen; porque les ha ido muy bien y agregaron a su negocio un punto de exhibición que es atendido por su hijo mayor en su administración, pues este adelanta estudios profesionales en Administración de Empresas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que planea comprar en mayor volumen, suelas, tacones capelladas, cuero y sintéticos, así como también pegante y pintura, para dar un elegante acabado a los nuevos diseños que han preparado especialmente para la celebración del día de las madres; temporada en la cual las familias aumentan su volumen de compras de estos productos y este es justamente la razón de éxito   de su credikiva, acompañada de su experiencia familiar en el área.
texts.en:
Fulton, 56 years old,lives in the city center with his wife and their 3 children, aged 13 to 22. Here they have a business making sandals, and they also sell their customers merchandise that varies by season. They offer their most faithful customers small-scale financing.  

Initially, Fulton was an iron monger, a skill he learned from family tradition. But the business began to deteriorate and he had to alter his activity and use this trade only occasionally, when a customer needed iron bars for doors or windows.  Now these bars are more a matter of decoration.

In 2006, his wife took a course through the 'National Learning Service' (SENA) and began making womens' sandals. Little by little, she gained a position among her neighbors and relatives to whom she was referred. Since she lacked sufficient working capital to respond to customer demand or to grow the business, she proposed to Fulton that he join her and invest his capital; she saw that this business would be more profitable than iron mongering. They began together the adventure of capturing the small merchant market in the cities of Barranquilla and, also, Cartagena, which today they have done. Things have gone very well and they have added a display location to their business, attended by their eldest son as administrator, while he pursues his professional studies in Business Administration. 

At present, Fulton is requesting a Kiva loan, his 1st through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase, in greater volume, soles, capped heels, leather, and synthetic materials, as well as glue and paint, to give an elegant finish to the new designs they have prepared, especially for the celebration of Mothers Day. This is a season when families increase their purchases of these products, and this will be precisely the reason for the success of their Kiva loan, that plus the family's experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy, in larger volume, soles, capped heels, leather, and synthetic materials, as well as glue and paint for their sandal making business.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 41-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his two working siblings. They are all cooperating together to be able to live a proper life. Abbas has been working independently as a taxi driver since 1996 and is looking forward to attracting more clients. He’s good and friendly and that is what makes people loyal to him. 

Today, he’s requesting to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen S.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his car and pay mechanic's fees. He’s sure that this will improve his business therefore increase his revenue.  In the future, he plans to buy a van and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car and pay mechanic's fees

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old, married, and lives in the Terjola district of West Georgia with her family: her husband David, her three children (14, 9, and 8 years old), and her parents. Natia and David lead the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows and a calf. Natia produces cheese and sells it in the village. The family also owns a small pig farm with a pig and ten piglets. The family sells an average of ten piglets per year in the village. Though all adult family members work hard on the family farm during the year, according to the Georgian government the family still lives in poverty and they receive a pension. The total average monthly income of the family, including social assistance, is 800 GEL. 

Natia requested credit to expand the family's dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow to increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. The family's income will increase by approximately 200 GEL per month. Natia will be able to purchase necessary household goods and improve the living conditions of her family members, especially her children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28 years old. He is married and has two children.

Moustafa has owned a shop since 2000, selling women's clothing and accessories. He has more than ten years' experience in this field, has a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for $3000 as “Youth Loan” in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: For three years, Adjoa has cooked kenkey for sale, which she serves with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Benyadzi near Elmina. She is married and has three children. She uses her income to help her husband feed and pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for preparing her kenkey. She hopes to use the profits from her business to build a food stall.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a woman with two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. For the last five years, Josephine has been selling clothes door-to-door to the general public. She faces the challenge of seasonality and says that her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food and school fees. Another source of livelihood includes earnings from her spouse. With the loan of Ksh. 20,000, she will be able to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Valentìn

texts.es:
Valentín  es un hombre que tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y su hijo. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Valentín  vive en  el caserío Pedregal Alto, distrito de Tambogrande,  departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuentan con el  servicio  básico de luz eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Valentín es la crianza/venta de ovinos, porcinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Valentín cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; el vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo se menciona que tiene 1.0 ha. De terreno agrícola instalada de cultivo de limón, lo cual le permite tener otros ingresos, su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Valentín se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de Fertilizantes y pago de jornales de limpieza del cultivo, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Valentín is a 25 year old man with a spouse and son in his care; he lives in his own house with his spouse and son.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in this community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some also work in agriculture.

Valentín lives in the settlement of Pedregal Alto in Tambogrande District, Piura Department.  They have electricity and water is provided by a communal well; all families that live there do so under these conditions.

The commercial activity Valentín does is raising sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl in corrals outside his house.  It’s worth mentioning that Valentín has two years’ experience that has allowed him to retain his business’ regular clientele; he sells his animals to local wholesalers.  He also mentions that he has one hectare of farmland planted with lemons that allows him to earn additional income; his spouse helps him with this activity.

At present, Valentín has proposed to increase his inventory with respect to the animals because this is a very profitable activity in the zone which is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 2000 new soles to buy fertilizer and to pay day laborers to help clear the fields which in time will allow him to gradually improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay his day laborers.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
En ciudad del este se forma el grupo “Mujeres Solidarias” entre 17 mujeres, quienes desean trabajar juntas y así ayudarse a ellas mismas y también a sus familias. Cuentan que gracias a su trabajo juntas ya están en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y su deseo es seguir creciendo.
Gabriela es una de estas mujeres emprendedoras, y además de eso es la presidenta, quien ayuda a sus compañeras, y con sus consejos las anima a poder seguir luchando por sus familias. Gabriela por su parte vende joyas a domicilio, tiene un gran número de clientes, ya que ella es muy amable, tiene buenos productos y también buenos precios. Su sueño es poder tener un local, para que no tenga que sacrificarse recorriendo.
En miras a ir cumpliendo su sueño ella pide un crédito, ya que quiere invertirlo en joyas, y de esa forma seguir trabajando para poder estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Solidarias group in Ciudad del Este is made up of 17 women who want to work together and so help themselves as well as their families.  They say that thanks to their work together they are already in the second loan cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras program, and their desire is to continue growing.

Gabriela is one of these enterprising women.  In addition to this she is the president, who helps her colleagues and, with her advice, encourages them to be able to continue struggling on behalf of their families.

For her part, Gabriela sells jewelry at home.  She has a large number of customers because she is very pleasant and because she has good products and good prices, too.  Her dream is to be able to have a place so she will not have to make sacrifices traveling around.

With a view to realizing her dream, she is requesting a loan because she wants to invest in jewelry.  In this way she will continue working to be able to be closer to her goal more all the time.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento de Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 48 años de edad y  es madre y padre para sus dos hijos. Lucila se dedica a la venta y compra de frutas, ella trae sus frutas del valle de Yanatile una vez a la semana, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como por ejemplo papaya, granadilla y otras más. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a la venta de frutas y le va muy bien. 

La socia Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociacion Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Lucila was born in the province of Cusco but now lives in the city of Cusco.  She is 48 years old and acts as both mother and father for her two children.  She buys and sells fruit and brings the fruit to Cusco from the Yanatile Valley once per week.  She is seeking this loan in order to buy fruit such as papaya, passion fruit and others.  She has been selling fruit for four years now, and it has been going very well.

Lucila is a member of the community bank "Siempre Adelante" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as papaya, passion fruit, and others.

loans.name: Elmira Del Carmen

texts.es: Elmira del Carmen es una emprendedora que tiene su actividad económica que es la pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace nueve años por lo tanto cuenta con una buena experiencia en dicha actividad, es una mujer honrada, trabajadora, de buenas  costumbres, y con mucha ganas de superación, hoy en dicha su pulpería esta surtida gracias al apoyo que fundación León 2000 le ha brindado con los financiamientos ya que los invierte en la compra de productos para satisfacer  la  demanda de sus clientes como:  arroz , azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente, fósforos, condimentos, verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Elmira del Carmen is an entrepreneur whose economic activity is a home-based grocery store she’s had for nine years so she has good experience in said activity.  She’s an honest, hardworking woman of good habits and with a strong desire for self-improvement.  

Today, her grocery store is stocked thanks to support Fundación León 2000 has provided her with loans that she’s used to buy products to meet customer demand like: rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, matches, condiments and vegetables, among others.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia Janet nació en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia del Cusco del departamento de Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Desde muy jovencita se vino a vivir a la ciudad del cusco y donde termino de estudiar la secundaria y después estudio la carrera técnica de cosmetología. Janet tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Janet como estudio cosmetología abrió un pequeño salón de belleza, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales y herramientas como por ejemplo un vaporizado que sirve para hidratar cabello.  

La socia Janet pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Janet was born in the city of Calca in Cusco Province and Cusco Department but currently lives in the city of Cusco. From a very young age she came to live in Cusco and completed secondary school there and then took a technical cosmetology course.

Janet is 29 years old and is in a common law relationship and has a son.  Because Janet studied cosmetology, she opened a small beauty salon and on this occasion needs the loan to buy more supplies and tools like a vaporizer, for example, that’s used to hydrate hair.

Janet belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This youth client is a borrower from Iraq. Ali is 22 years old, single, and lives with nine family members, six of whom work.

Ali is a barber; he opened his own shop in 2008, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting 2,400 USD as a "youth loan" to purchase a barber chair and to redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a barber chair and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba fries doughnuts for sale at Breman near Elmina. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accomodation bills. 

Araba will use her loan to purchase sugar, flour, and cooking oil to fry doughnuts for sale. With the new profits, Araba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her doughnut business.

loans.name: Sanjaa

texts.en:
Sanjaa is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a son in the Bayanhongor province of Southern Mongolia. Her son studies at the secondary school. 

Sanjaa started retailing beauty supplies in 2010 using her experience working as a beauty shop assistant. She also offers manicures and other beauty services. She has expanded her business several times, and her husband helps with the business. 

Sanjaa is an open and hardworking woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing beauty supplies in large quantities. I have a further plan to develop the business more." The total amount she is requesting is 2,974,000 MNT to buy beauty supplies.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Treicy Adriana

texts.es:
Treicy Adriana es una joven de 19 años, muy entusiasta y trabajadora, madre de un pequeño de 1 añito de edad al cual cría sola ya que por algunas razones ajenas el padre de su pequeño la abandono y desde ese entonces se ha convertido en padre y madre para él, por ello lucha cada día para darle una vida feliz y de calidad. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del año; también en esta ciudad se encuentra la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual es muy visitada por infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando Treicy Adriana tiene un tiempo un libre le gusta escuchar música al lado de su pequeño; asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería Técnica.

Con mucho entusiasmo Treicy Adriana trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la pequeña bodega que tiene en su casa; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 20 clientes de3 manera diaria; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes es la bodega más cercana de su barrio.

Treicy Adriana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio en especial menestras, arroz, fideos, enlatados entre otros; asimismo podrá comprar gaseosas, golosinas y bijouteria, con esta mejora tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad sus más grande su más sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Treicy Adriana is 19 years old. She is a very enthusiastic and hard-working woman, and she has young child aged 1. She cares for her child alone, because the father of her child abandoned them because of circumstances that lay outside of her power. Since then she has been a mother and a father for him, and it’s for him she strives every day, in order to grant him a quality and happy life. She lives in the town of Ica, famous for its hot and welcoming climate all year round; the Huacachina Lagoon is also there and it attracts an infinite number of tourists all year round. Whenever she has some free time, Treicy Adriana likes listening to music with her child; she also likes eating one of her favorite dish, the delicious “Arroz Chaufa” (fried rice). Owing to the insufficient economic resources of her parents, she could attend secondary school only, but she would have like to complete the technical degree in nursing.

Treicy Adriana works with great enthusiasm in her grocery store, located in her house. She works in her shop around 10 hours a day and she can tend to up to 20 customers a day. She believes things are going well for her activity because she is very kind with her customers and in her neighborhood is the closest in the nearby.

Treicy Adriana is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more products for her shop, such as vegetable stews, rice, noodles and canned food among other items. She will also buy fizzy drinks, sweets and costume jewelry. Thanks to this improvement she will offer a better variety of products to her customers , thus increasing her income. She will then be able to keep on working every day to make her biggest dream come true: “To provide her child with a good education”.

loans.use: To buy vegetable stews, rice, noodles, canned food, fizzy drinks, sweets and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Catalina lleva este nombre en honor a la santa patrona del barrio donde vivan las integrantes del grupo. Ellas son 19 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus familias. Están en el decimo segundo ciclo del programa con lo que se ve el gran entusiasmo y determinación que tienen.
Juliana, es miembro de este grupo, ella es la presidenta y nos cuenta que su comité es muy unido, y que gracias a esa unión están pasando muy bien cada ciclo que dejan atrás. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de cosméticos y de todas las marcas, con lo que mantiene a su familia. Ella misma se define como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
Juliana quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y es por eso que pide un crédito, que quiere invertirlo en cosméticos, ya que quiere estar siempre surtida con buena variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina Group is named in honor of the patron saint of the neighborhood in which its members reside.  There are 19 women, all of whom are hard-working, determined to get ahead, and they support their families through their jobs.  They are in the tenth second-program cycle for which they display great enthusiasm and determination.

Juliana is a member of the group.  She is president and tells us that because the group members are so close, they are easily getting through each cycle as they move forward.  Juliana sells all kinds of cosmetics, all of which are recognized brands, and with this income she supports her family.  She describes herself as a hard-working person and a fighter.

Juliana wants to continue building her business, so she is seeking a loan so that she can buy more cosmetics to ensure that she always has a good stock of a variety of products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband. They are both working hard to build a good future for their five children. Three of them are working and two are still attending school. 

In 2010, her husband opened his own mini-market. As for Amale, she decided to open her own home products shop in 2011 and is looking forward to growing her business. She sells all kinds of products at fair prices which attracts added customers.

 Today, she wants to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added home equipment for her shop such as kitchen utensils, plastic items and many others. She’s sure that buying these new supplies will help her earn superior income. In the future, she plans to work as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy added home equipment  for her shop such as kitchen utensils, plastic items and many others

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la provincia de La Convección del departamento de Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son quince años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco pues se vino por motivos de estudios de su hija, ella tiene 47 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Victoria se dedica a la venta y compra de frutas como por ejemplo plátanos, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. 

La socia Victoria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas, ella viaja al valle de La Convención de donde trae sus productos.  Su sueño de la socia Victoria es abrir una tienda donde pueda vender frutas traídas del norte del país como manzanas, melocotones, uvas y otras frutas más.  

La socia Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Victoria was born in the city of Quillabamba in Cusco Department’s La Convención Province but currently lives in the city of Cusco. She’s been living in Cusco for 15 years now since she moved here for her daughter’s schooling.  She’s 47 years old and in a common law relationship; she has three children.  

Victoria is a fruit merchant.  She buys and sells bananas, oranges, mandarins and papayas, for example.  She’s been in this business for several years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

On this occasion, Victoria needs the loan to buy more fruit.  She travels to La Convención Valley to get her products.  Victoria’s dream is to open a store to sell fruit brought from the north of the country like apples, peaches, grapes and other fruit as well.

Victoria belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Zeid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client, aged 25 years old, and married.

Zeid has owned a shop where he repairs and sells electrical generators since 2006. He has more than five years experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a $3000 “Youth Loan” in order to renovate his shop and install an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and install an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Alek

texts.en: Alek is a 37-year-old Lebanese man. He is single and lives with his parents. Alek has one sibling who works. His father is responsible for covering major living expenses. As for Alek, he opened his own car mechanic shop in 1993 after many years of experience in the trade. He’s a good mechanic and is looking to develop his work. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase car oils. This kiva loan will speed up his operations and generate a large profit. In the future, he plans to enlarge his garage and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase car oils.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol nació en la ciudad del Cusco – Perú, tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos pequeños. 

Marisol se dedica a la venta de productos de abarrotes en general, comercio que queda en su domicilio, en esta oportunidad Marisol necesita realizar un préstamo para surtir su tienda y comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azucar, sacos de arroz y otras cosas que sirviran para abastecer su tienda.

Marisol trabaja duro en su comercio hace varios años, y esta segura que con su trabajo ella podrá hacer crecer su empresa y podrá ampliarla.

Marisol pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Marisol was born in the town of Cusco, Peru; she is 30 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has 2 young children.
She sells groceries, an activity she has set up in her house. In this occasion Marisol needs a loan to stock up her inventory by purchasing products for her shop.

Marisol has been working hard in her field of activity for many years, and she is sure that thank to her job she will be able to make her activity grow and to expand it as well.

Marisol is a member of “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of Earthquakes II), a Communal Bank of the town of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, and other items

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia Benita nació en la ciudad de Sicuani de la provincia de Canchis del departamento de Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son doce años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco pues se vino por motivos de estudios,  ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Benita se dedica a la venta y compra de huevos de gallina y de codorniz. Ya son siete años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio.

La socia Benita en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar huevos. Sus proveedores le traen sus productos una vez a la semana de la ciudad de Chincha. La socia Benita pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Benita was born in the city of Sicuani in the province of Canchis in the department of Cusco, but she now lives in the city of Cusco.  She has lived in the city of Cusco for twelve years and originally came in order to study.  She is 31 years old, she is married, and because of this beautiful union she has two children.  Benita sells and buys chicken and quail eggs.  She has been in this business for seven years and thanks to her hard work, it has gone very well.

Benita needs a loan in order to buy more eggs.  Her suppliers bring the product once per week from the city of Chincha.  Benita belongs to the community bank "Siempre Adelante" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Yuli Maribel

texts.es:
Yuli   es una mujer que tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y su hijo. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura.
