Yuli vive en  el caserío Peña Viva, distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura, así mismo cuentan con  todos los  servicio  básico;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Yuli es la crianza/venta de porcinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Yuli cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Yuli se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 2500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados y mejoras en su vivienda, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yuli, 25, has a spouse and son in her care.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and son.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of its residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also work in agriculture too.  

Yuli lives in Tambogrande District’s Peña Viva settlement, Piura Department.  They have all basic utilities and all families living there do so under the same conditions.

Yuli’s commercial activity is raising pigs and barnyard fowl to sell; she raises them in corrals away from her house.  It’s worth mentioning that Yuli has 6 years’ experience in this experience which has allowed her to retain her business’ regular clientele.  She sells her animals to local wholesalers.  Her spouse helps her with her activity.

Yuli has proposed to increase her inventory with respect to the animals because this is a very profitable activity in the zone which is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 2500 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to do some home improvements which in time will allow her to gradually improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Francisco Placido

texts.es:
Francisco  es un hombre que tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y su hijo. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Francisco vive en  el caserío Tupac Amaru, distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura, así mismo cuentan con  todos los  servicio  básico;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Francisco es la crianza/venta de  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Francisco cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; el vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo  también se dedica a la agricultura como una actividad complementaria donde tiene instalado 1.0 ha, de limón donde viene cosechando semanalmente y esto le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales, su cónyuge también  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Francisco se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados y mantenimiento de su cultivo instalado, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, 44, has a spouse and son in his care; he lives in his own house with his spouse and son.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also work in agriculture. 

Francisco lives in Tambogrande District’s Tupac Amaru settlement, Piura Department; they have all basic utilities and all the families that live there do so under these conditions.

Francisco’s commercial activity is raising barnyard fowl to sell; he does so in corrals outside his house.  It’s worth mentioning that Francisco has 8 years’ experience which has allowed him to retain his business’ regular clientele.  He sells his animals to local wholesalers and also works in agriculture as an additional activity.  He has a hectare of land growing lemons that he harvests weekly thus earning extra income; his spouse helps him with this activity.

Currently, Francisco has proposed to expand his inventory with respect to the animal sales because this is a very profitable activity in the zone which is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 2000 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to maintain his active crops which in time will help him improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq is 47 years old and married with two sons. He is a foreman, but his primary business is serving people lunch and dinner in his café. He has four years of experience. He decided to start his own business several years ago because his income as a foreman was not stable and very low. 

People in Azerbaijan like to have lunch in national-style cafes, as well as spend time with friends in the evening drinking tea with homemade jam. Natiq`s place doesn’t look very attractive, but his food is delicious and that’s why his café is full of people.

His monthly income is 300 AZN and he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN. He will use this loan to renovate his café. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to renovate his cafe.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is a 23-year-old, single Lebanese man who lives with his parents and one working sibling. His father is the one responsible for covering their living expenses.

As for Nayef, he started his own business at an early age. Specifically, he opened his own mobile phone shop in 2008, where he also sells recharge cards. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional supplies for his business such as cell phones, recharge cards and many other items. He believes that this Kiva loan would increase his sales and thus profits. In the future, he plans to expand his business and diversify his items.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies such as cell phones, recharge cards and many other items

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir is a 57-year-old, married man with three children. He has been breeding livestock from a very young age, thanks to his father, who taught him the best breeding methods. With several years of experience under his belt, Sabir has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals he resells them for profts at the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan because people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His business operations require a lot of physical strength as Sabir spends most of his time in the open air, but his wife helps him to feed the animals.

He explains that his monthly income is approximately 300 AZN, but he hopes to increase his monthly income. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put to his business and cater to the market. For this purpose he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN. He will use the loan proceeds to buy cattle (two), one milk cow and fodder. This would be his fourth loan and he has a good record of repaying his loans.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, a milk cow and animal feed

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is taking another loan of Ksh 40,000 to expand on her existing business. She intends to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

The previous loan enabled her to increase her monthly income and her living standards have also improved. She aspires to open a cafe in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre de 57 años de edad,de estado civil casado que vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Morrope, que se encuentra ubicado a 50 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.Es una zona donde su actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio; además cuentan con los servicios bàsicos de luz, agua y desague.

Ángel se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores; desde hace 11 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres; él cría a sus animales en un terreno ubicado cerca a su casa que fue otorgado por su padres.Asimismo tiene bastante experiencia en este tipo de negocio y cuenta con clientes ya establecidos.Su cónyuge también le apoya en esta actividad.

Ángel desea se le otorgue el monto de 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado porcino y construcción de corrales para sus animales; así también desea adquirir un motor para el bombeo de agua hacia su terreno.
texts.en: Ángel is a 57 year-old married man who lives with his wife in the urban marginal zone of Mórrope district, some 50 minutes away from Lambayeque proper. Ángel has been raising and selling animals for 11 years, a trade which was taught to him by his mother. He uses a plot of land near his house that was given to him by his father. Ángel asks for a 3,000 soles loan to buy porcine cattle and to build corrals for his animals; he also wishes to buy an engine to irrigate his land.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, improve their corrals, and an engine to pump water

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene 56 años de edad, esta casada y nació en Andahuaylillas y actualmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, y a la producción de frutales.

La señora María Isabel ha crecido mucho en su negocio, por ello está muy agradecida con esta modalidad de ayuda que recibe, y que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones y desarrollo.

La señora María Isabel en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para comenzar a iniciar su comercio, adquirir  animales y dotar de infraestructura y alimento a su negocio. Ella está segura que pronto tendrá una pequeña granja, lo cual sería el objetivo de todo su trabajo.

La señora María Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; ubicados en el distrito de Andahuaylillas Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 56 years old and is married.  She was born in Andahuaylillas and currently raises small animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.  Sra. María Isabel has grown considerably in her business, so she is grateful for the type of assistance that she has received.  She has gained much satisfaction and has undergone development.  

María Isabel is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can undertake the start of her trading business.  She will acquire animals, build the infrastructure, and buy feed for her business.  María Isabel is confident that her small farm will develop quickly because all of her efforts will be directed to this goal.  She is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" (The Winners), which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy animals, feed, and other supplies.

loans.name: Yen Ssi Melody

texts.es:
Yen  es una joven de 29 años, es muy entusiasta y sobre todo trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y porque en este distrito se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika, pallares, entre otros, aquí también se encuentran varias agroexportadoras las cuales brindan muchos empleos a los pobladores de la zona; cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar secretariado ejecutivo pero también le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Agrónoma.

Día a día Yen trabaja en su negocio de alquiler de taxi, ella trabaja alrededor de 4 horas diarias, asimismo trabaja en una recicladora, revisando los envases; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo respetuosa con los clientes.

Yen está muy agradecida con los prestata rios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y también poder tarrajear el cuarto donde vive, así tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y también mejorara su  calidad de vida, así ella podrá seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yen is a 29-year-old young woman.  She is very enthusiastic and hardworking.  She lives in the district of Santiago, which is known for having a warm climate and the farming that takes place here, especially cotton, asparagus, paprika, and butter beans, among other things.  There are also various agro-export companies that offer a lot of jobs to the residents of the area.

When she has some free time she likes to listen to music as well as eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious chicken and rice.  With a lot of effort she managed to study to be an executive secretary, but she also would like to have studied agricultural engineering.

Every day Yen works about four hours a day in her taxi-rental business.  She also works in a recycling plant, checking the containers.  She believes it is going well for her in her business because she is very friendly and above all respectful with the customers.

Yen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to perform maintenance on her vehicle and also cement the room where she lives.  In this way she will have a vehicle in good condition.  Also, her quality of life will improve and she will be able to continue working every day to make her biggest dream come true: "To have her own house."

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her vehicle and to cement a room.

loans.name: Emilina Antonia

texts.es: Emelina Antonia es una mujer luchadora, desde hace un tiempo que labora como domestica siendo un trabajo de mucho esfuerzo. Madre de tres pequeños todos menores de edad, los cuales se encuentran en periodo escolar. Su esposo quien es maestro de obra le ayuda con los gastos del hogar siempre y cuando esta trabajando ya que aveces labora por temporadas, por no tener un contrato laboral fijo. En esta ocasión el destino que tendra este credito sera para la construccion de muro perimetral de su vivienda, logrando con este detener el agua que se le viene de frente a su humilde casa, para llevar a cabo dicho plan necesitara comprar piedrin, hierro, bloques, cemento, arena, alambre de amarre, piedras canteras entre otros materiales de construccion. Sus proyectos para este 2012 es optar a un mejor puesto de empleo mismo que le sirva para ella poderles brindar a su familia mejores nivel de vida y asi cumplir con sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
Emelina Antonia is a tenacious woman who has been working as a domestic employee for some time, a job that requires much effort.  She’s the mother of three minor children who are school age.  Her husband is a master builder who helps her with household expenses always and when he’s working because sometimes he only works seasonally because he does not have a steady job.

On this occasion the loan will be used to build a wall around her house that will keep water from flooding the front of her humble abode.  To carry out this project she needs to buy gravel, rebar, concrete blocks, cement, sand, wire and paving stones, among other building materials and supplies.

Her project for 2012 is to get a better job so that she can provide her family with a better standard of living and to be able to make her payments.

loans.use: to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The member continues to run her hardware shop, in addition to focusing on sales of spare parts for cars. She is twenty-eight years old and lives with her partner and one son who is nearly two years old. A loan will help her purchase more products such as sidelights, headlights, and lubricants. The member says that she looks forward to expanding her three-year-old business by filling her store with more merchandise for her customers.

The member is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Maria Auxiliadora" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 10th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars, including sidelights, headlights, and lubricants.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort lives together with her husband and 4 children at Ankyernyin near Takoradi. Her husband works at the harbor. Comfort operates this grocery store, which she has done for some years now. She uses the income to assist her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Comfort needs this loan to purchase groceries to sell.  With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Judith, who is in her late 40s, is married with two children who are in college.  She owns two shops, a retail shop and a clothes shop.  She has been in this business since 1980.  She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the missing items in her shops and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to open another clothing shop.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a car.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Jaguar," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to open another shop for clothes.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 29-year-old youth client. He is married and has two children.

Mohamad is a barber. In 2009 he opened his own shop, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $3,000 as a "Youth loan" to renovate his shop’s walls and floors and to install an advertising light box. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop’s walls and floors and to install an advertising light box.

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en:
Sakit is a 53-year-old, married man with one daughter. For ten years, he has grown fruits and vegetables in his garden. As a result, he is a very experienced farmer with significant knowledge of the land and how to cultivate it. He was not able to find a job for several years, so he decided to start his own business. He is the only source of income for his family.

Sakit usually grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profits at the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and are in high demand because they are very healthy daily food options for people in the area. In addition, one of the popular national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is approximately 200 AZN.

Now Sakit would like to invest more capital in his business so that he can purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN. He hopes that the loan proceeds will improve his family's living conditions. This would be his third loan and he explains that he has a good history of repaying his loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un hombre de 42 años de edad; vive con su menor hijo en el Caserío el Papayo, distrito de Motupe que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media del Distrito de Lambayeque.

Martin se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en una mototaxi, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años en la misma zona , aprendió esta actividad de su padre.

El crédito que solicita es de S/.1.200 Nuevos soles; que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo(compra de neumáticos, cámara, cambio de aceite, afinamiento) y compra de soat(En el Perú, SOAT es Seguro Obligatorio para Accidentes de Tránsito - Seguro para los transportistas); para que de esa manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
Martin is a 42-year-old client.  He lives with his younger child in the village of El Papayo in the city of Motupe, which is located an hour and a half away from the district of Lambayeque.

Martin works transporting passengers in a motor-taxi.  He has been doing this for the last ten years in the same area or those nearby.  He learned this business from his father.

The loan that he is requesting is for 1,200 soles, which will be used to increase his working capital.  In this way he will be able to earn more income for his household and so be able to improve his quality of life.  There is not much competition in this field in his area, so Martin has an already established customer base.

loans.use: to purchase pneumatic tires, chambers, oil, and transportation insurance

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José  es un hombre de 60 años de edad, sus hijos son mayores de edad que ya no viven con él. Vive en casa propia con su esposa, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Amaru  del distrito de Tambogrande. José vive en esta zona rural , y no  cuenta con servicios básicos en su domicilio.La mayoría de familias viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura,posee predio propio en el cual tiene sembrado plantaciones de limón en producción, que cosecha y vende semanalmente. Esta actividad la realiza hace más de 7 años y le han sabido dar muchos beneficios económicos. Además en su domicilio cría ganado ovino y aves de corral como pavos, gallinas, los cuales comercializa en mercado local,esto al haber alcanzado el peso y tamaño ideal. Su esposa lo apoya en sus actividades complementarias, como el cuidado de las aves y en algunas labores agrícolas.
El monto solicitado por José es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en el cuidado, limpieza y mantenimiento del cultivo de limón, básicamente en compra de insumos químicos para limpieza de cultivos, esto con la finalidad de evitar cualquier tipo de plagas,lo que le va permitir aminorar el riesgo en la cosecha.  Con los ingresos que perciba de la venta del limón y ganado le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 60, is a married man but no longer has children dependent on him.  He lives in his own house with his wife located in the Amaru Inca Valle de los Incas settlement in Tambogrande District.  José lives in the rural zone which is why he has no basic utilities in his house.

The activity José does is agriculture.  He has his own parcel planted with lemons that are harvested and sold weekly.  He’s been in this line of work for more than 7 years and it’s given him many economic benefits.  In addition, he also raises sheep and barnyard fowl like turkeys and chickens at home that are sold at the local market when they reach ideal size and weight.  His wife helps him with complementary activities like caring for the fowl and with some of the farming chores.

The amount José is asking for is 2000 new soles that he will use to care for, clear and maintain his lemon crops that he has on his own parcel.  This maintenance will include weeding, harvesting, etc.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides for his lemon harvest

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo es un hombre de 22 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y con 01 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa familiar con su conviviente y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Platillos del distrito de Tambogrande del departamento de Piura y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 150 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Heberardo es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años aproximadamente,y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente se dedica a a la agricultura donde cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola que ha sido herencia de sus padres en donde siembra maíz y arroz lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y la compra de calaminas para el techo de su corral, está inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 22 years old. He lives with his partner and one son. His home is located in the Caserío Platillos, Tambogrande district. His house has electricity and is located in a small community of approximately 150 families. Heberardo makes a living raising and selling of small livestock (sheep, goats, pigs, goats and poultry), which after they have achieved exact size and weight, he sells in the local market. He has been doing this activity from 6 years ago approximately, the business is located in his home. He learned this activity from his parents, that is to say, that he knows it to the perfection.

In addition he makes a living farming. He has one hectare of agricultural land that has been an inheritance of his parents, there he cultivates corn and rice which allows him to have additional income.

The amount of the requested loan is 1000 new soles, which will be used to invest in the purchase of balanced food to feed his livestock and the purchase of zinc sheets for the roof of his barnyard, this investment will allow him to continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase balanced food to feed his livestock and the purchase of zinc sheets for the roof of his barnyard

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 KES, to start a tailoring business. With the loan proceeds, she will be able to purchase clothing materials and to add another sewing machine to her operation. Since her last loan, her business has grown and her monthly income has increased.

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing materials.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier es un hombre casado, padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años; vive con su familia en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de  Bolívar, de tradición artesanal y se dedica a la venta de mochilas y hamacas. Su negocio inició hace 6 años, y como el lo dice “ha sido de mucha bendición para la familia”, pues de allí genera su diario sustento. Las principales líneas de productos de su oferta son los bolsos, las mochilas y materiales para la elaboración de estas prendas, productos que han llegado a venderse en Argentina, Panamá y España. La meta de Javier  es lograr conseguir mercados importantes, para el crecimiento de su negocio y su mayor desafío es lograr ser más competitivo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como hilos y fique, en mayor volumen, pues para aumentar sus ventas requiere producir en más número de prendas y tener mayor disponibilidad de insumos en su inventario y este es justamente el propósito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Javier is married and the father of three children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years; he lives with his family in San Jacinto, a town in Bolívar Department.  

By tradition, he’s a craftsman; he sells hammocks and backpacks.  He started the business six years ago and like he says, “it’s been of much benefit for the family,” because it provides their daily sustenance.  The main lines of products he offers are bags, backpacks and the materials to make such items which have been sold in Argentina, Panamá and Spain.  Javier’s goal is to acquire important markets for his business’ growth and his greatest challenge is to become more competitive.

He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy raw materials like thread and ‘fique’ [fiber made from the agave plant] in larger amounts because in order to increase sales he needs to produce more items and have raw materials on hand to do so and this is precisely the purpose of this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in larger amounts.

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 02 hijos.  Vive en Oyotún, distrito de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.  Cuenta con buenas relaciones con sus vecinos, vive en casa propia y tiene buenas referencias personales.

Vidalina se dedica a la venta de animales, además de venta de leche, esto en su propio domicilio y desde hace 11 años.  Adicionalmente se dedica a labores de campo (jornaleria), básicamente en el recojo de fruta en cosecha.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de sus hijos.  Con el anhelo de seguir mejorando cada día, ella se esfuerza para seguir trabajando y brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor posible.

Vidalina en el afán de ofrecerle a sus hijos lo mejor para sus vidas, piensa que lo más importante es la educación, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para apoyar en la educación a su hijo, quien está estudiando en un instituto.

Vidalina es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Vidalina is a 49-year-old woman.  She is single and has two children in her care. She lives in Oyotún, district of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque. She lives in her own home together with her children.

Viviana's business activity is raising and selling livestock (cows, goats, pigs and farmyard birds).  She also sells milk.  When her animals have reached an appropriate size and weight, she sells them in the local market.  She has been in this line of work for approximately 11 years.  The business is located outside her home and she learned it from her parents which means that she knows it like the back of her hand.  Vidalina's husband is a farmer.  He supports her financially which provides her with additional income.

Viviana has requested a loan for 2,000 soles which she will use to invest in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals and to support her son who is studying his higher education in the city of Chiclayo.  It will enable her to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to support her son in his higher education

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 51 years old, married and has three children. All of his children work.

Since 2011, Adnan has owned and operated a restaurant, where he offers different types of food to customers. He gained a great deal of experience in this field from his previous line of work. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a loan in the amount of $2,400 in order to install a sliding door in his restaurant and to purchase an electrical generator. He is aiming to generate more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to improve his restaurant by installing a sliding door and purchasing an electrical generator.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio   es un hombre de 65 años de edad, estado civil casado, con 01 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Guaraguaos Bajo distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 300 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Braulio es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno y tiene instalado plantación de mango y limón. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 18 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Su cónyuge tiene negocio de picantería en su propio domicilio donde le apoya económicamente.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en mantenimiento  del cultivo  y compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Braulio is 65 years old, married, and has one son still in his care. He lives in his own house with his wife and son. The house is located in the hamlet of Guaraguaos Bajo , Tambogrande district, and has electricity. The community has approximately 300 families.

Braulio's work is raising young animals (sheep, goats, pigs, and poultry), which he sells in the local market. He also works in agriculture and has a plot of land where he has established a mango and lemon plantation. He has been doing this work since he was approximately 18 years old and learned it from his parents. In other words, he knows this work perfectly. His wife has her own business, a food stall, in their home, where she contributes her economic support.

The amount of the requested loan is 2,000 nuevos soles, which Braulio will use to invest in crop maintenance and to purchase fertilizers for his crops. This will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and maintain his crops

loans.name: Elesvan

texts.es:
Elesvan  es un hombre de 45 años de edad, estado civil casado, con 04 hijos menores a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Cruz del Médano del  distrito de Mòrrope y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 400 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Elesvan es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno y tiene instalado plantación de maíz. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1800 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en mantenimiento  del cultivo  y compra de alimentos, vitaminas para sus animales, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Elesvan is a 45 year old married man with four minor children in his care.  He lives in his own house with his spouse and children.  The house is located in Caserío Cruz del Médano in Mórrope District and it has electricity.  The place is a community of approximately 400 families.

The activity Elesvan does is raising small farm animals (sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell in the local market.  He also farms; he has a field planted with corn.  He’s been in this activity for approximately six years and learned it from his parents which means he knows the line of work to perfection.

The amount of the loan requested is 1800 new soles that will be used for crop maintenance and to buy feed and vitamins for his animals which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vitamins and to provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo  es un hombre de 49 años de edad, estado civil casado, con 02 hijos menores a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Palominos del  distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Lorenzo es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), donde lo comercializa en el mercado local; complementariamente es trabajador estable en un fundo agrícola  en la zona. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años aproximadamente; así mismo realiza en sus tiempos libres transporte de pasajeros, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Su cónyuge se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de alimentos, vitaminas para sus animales,  lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 49, has a common-law wife and 2 young children and all live in their own house. It is located in the Palominos community of about 100 families, Tambogrande district, and it has electricity.
Lorenzo raises small animals (sheep, pigs, goats and poultry) which he sells at the local market.  He also has a regular job at a large farm in the area.  He has done this work since he was about 12, and in his free time he gives people rides since he knows the area perfectly.  His partner makes and sells chicha de jora (a traditional Peruvian drink made from corn ).
He is requesting 1000 new sols to buy food and vitamins for his animals.  This will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food to fatten his animals as well as vitamins

loans.name: Segundo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Segundo   es un hombre de 44 años de edad, separado y con 3 hijos dependientes que estan asu cargo, Vive  en casa  propia  con sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío San Martín  del  distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, agua, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 90 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Segundo es la crianza de animales menores donde los cría y vende en el mercado local de la zona; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno  (1.75 has) y tiene instalado limón y mango donde presenta buen desarrollo fenològico. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Así mismo lo apoyan sus hijos en la chacra.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, bioestimulantes y pago de jornales  del cultivo y mejoras de una unidad móvil, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 44 year old man who is separated and has 3 children who live with him. He lives in his own house with his children. The house is located in Caserío San Martín in the district of Tambogrande and has electrical service and town water. The place is a community of about 90 families. 
Segundo works raising small animals and selling them in the local market. He also works as a farmer and has 1.75 hectares where he grows lemon and mango, which grow well. He has been doing this for about 10 years and learned this work from his parents. It could be said that he knows this work perfectly. The farm also supports his children.
The amount of the requested loan is $400. He will use it to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the laborers for their work and to improve a mobile unit. All this will enable him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies and to pay the laborers for their work and to improve a mobile unit.

loans.name: Norma Zenith

texts.es: Norma de 49 años es una mujer casada que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 17 a 22 años. Ella tiene un taller confecciones que inició desde el año 1986, cuando finalizó sus estudios de diseño de modas y con el apoyo de su esposo quien le regaló su primera máquina de coser y una fileteadora,  inició haciendo costuras para sus amigas, hasta que en el año 1990 con el producto de sus ahorros, lo organizó su taller, comprando nuevas maquinarias e inició con la confección de uniformes, disfraces cortinas y edredones; sus principales clientes son los colegios,  hostales,  vecinos y familiares, que cada vez mas le recomiendan nuevos clientes, con los cuales le ha ido muy bien. Su meta es continuar prosperando con el apoyo de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para la fabricación de blusas femeninas, vestidos, cortinas y edredones; esta inversión la hará en vísperas de la celebración del día de las madres, porque sus clientela ya está  haciendo sus encargos,  para estar elegantes en ese día y entregar detalles a todas las mujeres de la familia que son madres. Esta inversión proyecta ser exitosa por la experiencia de Norma en este negocio, porque además hace su inversión en una temporada en la que usualmente, las ventas se incrementan y porque responde a pedidos de clientes selectos.
texts.en:
Norma, 49, is a married woman living in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children whose ages range from 17 to 22 years.  She has a sewing shop she opened in 1986 when she completed her dressmaking courses and with support from her husband who gave her her first sewing machine and a serger sewing machine.  

She started out doing sewing for her girlfriends until 1990 when with profits from her business was able to set up her shop buying new machines and started manufacturing uniforms, costumes, curtains and comforters.  Her main customers are schools, inns, neighbors and family members who recommend new customers to her all the time and that she’s been doing very well with.

Her goal is to continue making progress with support from her Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy raw materials to manufacture women’s blouses, dresses, curtains and comforters.  She will make this investment on the eve of Mother’s Day because her clientele has already placed orders to be elegant that Mother’s Day and to offer gifts to all the women in the family who are mothers.

This project is projected to be successful because of Norma’s experience in this business and also because she’s making the investment at a time when sales usually increase and because she’s responding to pending orders from select customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Gabriel

texts.es: Pedro de 28 años, es un joven casado que tiene un hijo en la edad de un año. El vive con su familia en San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio del Departamento de Bolívar, donde tiene una tienda y vende ranchos víveres, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar, con una frecuencia diaria, de contado  y en pequeñas cantidades, como lo solicitan las familias de su alrededor para alimentarse todos los días. Su negocio nació en el año 2010, con un 10% del capital que ahora tiene porque ha crecido, está ubicado en un pequeño local que mide aproximadamente 2 por 5 metros. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y su mayor desafío es lograr tener un capital de trabajo suficiente,  para ampliar su locación y condicionarlo mejor. Esta es la razón de acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías y materiales de construcción para ampliar el local. Con su credikiva aumentará las posibilidades de recibir un número mayor de clientes de manera confortable y tendrá inventarios de los productos que mas rotan, con lo cual aumentará su volumen de ventas y esto es justamente lo que se constituye en el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Pedro, 28, is a young married man; he has a one year old son.  He lives with his family in San Juan Nepomuceno, a town in Bolívar Department, where he has a store where he sells snacks, foodstuffs, beverages and basic staple items every day for cash and in small amounts like families in the area request for their daily meals. 
 
His store opened in 2010 with just 10% of his current capital because he’s grown.  He’s located in a small, approximately 2 meters by 5 meters, locale.  His goal is to make his business grow and his greatest challenge is to have enough working capital to expand and better equip his store.

This is the reason for accessing a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy building materials and supplies to expand the locale.  With his Kiva loan his possibility of obtaining a larger number of customers in a comfortable manner will increase and he will have more of the products that are best-sellers on hand which will increases sales levels and this is precisely what his investment’s success is based on.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis  es una hombre de 41 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 02 hijo menor a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Cruz del Médano del distrito de Mòrrope y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 200 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Luis es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 11 años aproximadamente; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.Asi mismo tambien es agricultor y cuenta con parcela propia en la cual tiene instalado maíz lo cual le permite tener otros ingresos.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de alimento para engorde y vitaminas para sus animales,  lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a 41-year-old man who is married with two minor children under his care. He lives in his own house with his spouse and children. The house is located in the Cruz del Médano neighborhood in the district of Mòrrope. It has electricity and is in a community of approximately 200 families. 

The business that Luis has developed is the raising of small animals (sheep, goats, pigs, and fowl), which he sells at the local market. He has been in this business for approximately 11 years, in other words he knows the field to perfection. His spouse is a farmer with her own plot of land in which he grows corn. It has started to support the family expenses. 

The amount of the loan requested in 3,000 nuevos soles which they will use to invest in the purchase of vitamins and feed to fatten up the animals which will allow him to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his animals.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a married woman with three children. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her mother. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utilities.

To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes at the market. She works six days a week, and she has been in this business for seven years. She explains that her major business challenges include seasonality and her customers' default rates.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Prossy hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business so that she can start importing clothese from Mombasa.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 28-year-old, married man with one child.

Since 2009, Salah has owned and operated a shop where he sells mobile phones and phone accessories. He has experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a "youth" loan in the amount of $2,400 in order to install an outdoor roof, to purchase a computer and an air conditioner. He is aiming to generate more profits so that he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to improve his business by installing a roof and purchasing a computer and air conditioner.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child, who is in the second grade. Her husband is a businessman, who supports her and her family. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She spends much of her income each month on rent and food.

For the last two years, Fatuma has been operating a tailoring business from her home. She dreams of opening a tailoring training college in the future. Fatuma is now seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to purchase clothing materials and another sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing materials and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Sineno

texts.en:
Sineno is a married mother of two children, one of whom attends school while the other is too young for school.  She has rented a house that has electricity but not running water.

Sineno sells charcoal from her home and has been in this business for the past six months.  Her goal is to open a kiosk in the future.  High transportation costs are her major challenge.  

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to loans.  Sineno plans to use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nadia Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Nadia Parveen is a 30-year-old married woman with four children: two daughters and two sons. Her daughters are attending school while her sons are free and stay at home. 
Nadia herself is a housewife. She prefers staying at home and does household work. She has a set routine to get up early in the morning, ready her daughters for school, and prepare breakfast for her family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 
Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electronics and electricity repairing services to the customers. He has been in this profession for the past 4 years and satisfies his customers through his good skills. 
Nadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying the latest electricity repairing tools to provide better quality repairing services. Nadia is hopeful that with the latest repairing tools her husband will be able to provide services to many more customers and can generate a good income.

Note: One of the members has a sewing business. That's why she is showing it in the picture.

loans.use: To buy the latest electrical repair tools

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Рамазон на протяжении 30 лет занимается продажей женской бижутерии. Изделий из серебра таких серьги, кольца браслеты. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Жена занимается воспитанием детей  и уходом за хозяйством. В бизнесе ему помогает сын Фаридун. Кроме продажи изделий он также занимается частичным изготовлением изделий из серебра. Он оформляет изделия разными драгоценными камнями. Он хочет получить займ для пополнения товарооборота и приобретения сырья. Он надеется на помощь, так как летом у него сезон на его товар и большой спрос.
texts.en: Ramazon has been selling women's jewelry for some 30 years. He sells silver jewelry, such as earrings, rings, and bracelets. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. His son Faridun helps him in the business. In addition to selling, Ramazon also makes some of the silver jewelry himself. He sets  various gemstones in silver mountings. He would like to obtain a loan to increase his stock and also buy raw materials. He hopes for your help since the summer is  a busy season for him, and his wares are in demand.

loans.use: to purchase  raw materials [for silver jewelry].

loans.name: Alyar

texts.en:
Alyar is a 50-year-old, married man with two children. He has been breeding livestock from a very young age, thanks to his father, who taught him the best breeding techniques. During his years of experience, Alyar has acquired a great deal of knowledge and skills required for the business. Now he has a large livestock farm.

He purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals he resells them for profits at the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan because people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His explains that his business requires a lot of physical strength as Alyar spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals.

His monthly income is approximately 300 AZN, but Alyar wishes to increase his income in the future. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put to his business and to reach the market. For this purpose he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN. He would use the loan proceeds to buy three cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es: Leyla  de 47 años, vive en la Ciudad de Cartagena de Indias,  con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 21 años. Allí tiene un salón de belleza donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen a todas las familias que la rodean. Su idea de negocio inició, cuando a los 16 años hizo un curso de peluquería por las noches y al mismo tiempo trabajaba de día, pues la profesora la contrató al ver su entusiasmo y su capacidad de aplicar lo aprendido, logrando así una gran experiencia, que tiempo después capitalizó en un negocio, como hoy lo tiene. Ella empezó comprando con sus propios ingresos,  las herramientas de trabajo y continuó actualizándose en el tema de belleza, por eso poco a poco amplió sus posibilidades de crecimiento, comprando enseres para organizar un punto de atención; su ganas de avanzar le facilitó el tener una academia y ofrecía clases; posteriormente se hizo reconocida y consiguió un trabajo en el que tenia que viajar frecuentemente, por eso cambió su negocio por un buen empleo, pero 5 años después regresó a su inicial idea, la de tener su propio negocio. Con este  le ha ido muy bien y simultáneamente genera ingresos por la venta de mercancías, especialmente las asociadas a la belleza, así ella asesora y vende productos cosméticos y capilares al mismo tiempo y esto es lo que más le gusta a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tratamientos capilares y productos cosméticos, así como una vitrina para mantener bien ordenado su inventario. El éxito de su credikiva es su gran experiencia y el logro de disminuir sus costos, comprando de contado y en mayor volumen y justamente eso es lo que persigue Leyla.
texts.en:
Leyla, 47, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 21 years.  She has a beauty salon here where she offers image improvement services to all surrounding families.  The idea for her business arose when she took a barber course at night at the age of 16 while working days because her teacher hired her when she saw her enthusiasm and ability to apply what she learned.  She acquired vast experience this way which in time she capitalized into her business like she has to this day.

She started out buying work tools with her own income and continued updating in beauty topics so was able to gradually expand her growth possibility buying furnishings to equip her salon. Her drive to make progress led to her opening an academy and she taught courses becoming well-known later on.  She then got a job that required her to travel frequently so she swapped her business for a good job but five years after that she returned to her original idea of having her own business.  She’s done very well with this one and she also generates income selling merchandise, especially beauty-associated goods.  She is a cosmetics and hair-treatments advisor and saleswoman and this is what her customers like best.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy hair treatments and cosmetics as well as a display case to keep her inventory well organized.  The success of her Kiva loan is her vast experience and diminished costs by paying cash and in large volume and this is precisely what Leyla is going after.

loans.use: to buy supplies, equipment and a display case for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is a 40-year-old man who is married and has two sons. He is a market vendor and sells potatoes, onions, and other seasonal vegetables in his wholesale market. He has ten years of experience in this field. He rents a car to drive around the villages and buy fresh potatoes and onions from local farmers which he then sells for a profit. He usually makes this gathering twice a month.

His business brings him a stable income of AZN 250 and this is the only source of income for his family. Fresh and organic vegetables are very popular among local people and Bakhtiyar always chooses the best to sell.

He applied for a loan of AZN 1500 to purchase more vegetables to sell as it is summertime and people use fresh vegetables almost every day. This will be his third loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling fish for the past six years. Mwanakombo owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. In addition, she owns some rental houses which provide her with another source of income. She aspires to own several rental houses. She describes seasonality as her major challenge, and food and school fees as her greatest monthly expenses. 
Mwanakombo plans to purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses with the loan of Ksh 40,000.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 30-year-old single Lebanese woman living with her parents and four siblings. Three of them are working. Her father is the one responsible for providing for their needs. Even so, they are all unified, depending on each other and grateful for what god has given them. Nada has owned a lingerie shop since 2002. Today, she wants to borrow a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to enlarge her shop and buy additional lingerie in order to earn better income. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her shop and buy additional lingerie.

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
La socia Saida nació en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia del Cusco del departamento de Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Desde muy niña se vino a vivir a la ciudad del Cusco y donde termino de estudiar la secundaria. La socia Saida tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. la socia Saida y su esposo se dedican al transporte, ella es la administradora del negocio y él es el chofer, él brinda  servicio de transporte en su propio carro en la ciudad de Calca hacia la ciudad de lares y viceversa, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro desea comprar lubricantes, aceites y otras cosas más. 

La socia Saida pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Saida was born in the city of Calca in the province of Cusco, but now lives in the city of Cusco.  When she was young she came to live in the city of Cusco and that is where she finished secondary school.  Saida is 21 years old, she is married by common law, and she has one child. 

Saida and her husband are in the transportation business.  She is the business manager and her husband is the chauffeur.  He provides transportation services in his own car from the city of Calca to the city of Lares and back.  Saida is asking for a loan so that she can perform maintenance on the car.  She needs to buy lubricants, oils, and other items.

Saida is a member of the community bank "Siempre Adelante" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car.  She needs to buy lubricants, oils and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes   es una mujer que tiene 62 años de edad, de estado civil casada, sin ningún  hijo a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Mercedes vive en  el caserío Santa Isabel, distrito de Mòrrope, departamento de Lambayeque, así mismo cuentan con  todos los  servicio  básico;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Mercedes es la crianza/venta de porcinos, caprinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Mercedes cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Mercedes se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados y mejoras de corrales, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 62 year old married woman with no children.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband.  Most of the community residents are independent workers who sell and raise small animals and a few of them also farm.  Mercedes lives in the Santa Isabel settlement, within the Mòrrope zone and the Lambayeque department.  They have all of the basic services.  All of the families living there live under the same conditions.

Mercedes raises and sells pigs, goats, and corral birds.  She raises the animals in the area outside her home and has been doing this for five years, allowing her to keep her established customers in this business.  She sells her animals to large businesses in the zone.  Her husband supports her activities.

Currently Mercedes has proposed expanding her inventory for buying and selling animals, since this is a very profitable business in her zone.  For this reason she requested a new loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy balanced feed and better animal pens.  This will eventually allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and animal pens.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and four children. He’s trying the best he can to cover his family's expenses. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1999, independently responding to customer's requests. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new car. In that way, he will be capable of carrying on with his business in the proper way without facing problems. In the future, he plans to buy a minivan in order to transport more people.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is 30 years old.  He is married and has one son.  He used to work as taxi driver but his salary was too low, so he started his own business.  For the past two years, he has been selling mobile phones and accessories in his shop.  He earns a monthly income of 200 AZN. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN to expand his business and purchase more merchandise.  Mobile phones are very popular and Karim wishes to diversify his inventory of phones to meet market demand.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and diversify his range of merchandise.

loans.name: Mehassan

texts.en: Mehassan is a divorced woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She operates a fish selling business and has been in this business for the last ten years, selling at the market to the general public. She aspires to be the best supplier of fish in the region. Mehassan lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and school fees. She joined Yehu because of their good products. With the loan of KES 20,000, she intends to buy stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Karla Jesennia

texts.es: Karla es una mujer dedicada a sus hijas quienes son estudiantes. Sus proyectos siempre se han trazado en la construccion de su vivienda pues considera ser la mejor herencia que les pueda otorgar a sus dos pequeñas. Actualmente labora como domestica trabajo de mucho desgaste fisico, sin embargo su salario no le da para que de una vez por completo ella junto a su familia gocen de mejores comodidades, es por ello el motivo que acude una vez mas a la micro-financiera siendo este su decimo ciclo de credito se propone comprar hierro, laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, clavos, madera, arena, alambre de amarre, piedrin entre otros materiales y asi empezar a levantar totalmente su casa de concreto. Su esposo quien es taxista le ayuda a cubrir gastos del hogar por lo que se siente apoyada ya que se puede equilibrar tanto con sus compromisos de pago como con las obligaciones del hogar.
texts.en:
Karla is a woman dedicated to her daughters who are students.  Her projects have always been focused on the construction of her home because she considers that to be the best inheritance that she can leave for her two small children.  

Karla is a domestic worker and does a lot of physical work; however, her salary does not provide her the equivalent of full-time wages.  In order for Karla and her family to enjoy better amenities, she is once again seeking a micro-finance loan, which will be her tenth loan.  

She needs to buy iron, zinc sheets, concrete blocks, cement, nails, wood, sand, tie wire, gravel, and other materials so that she can begin to completely rebuild her concrete home.  Her husband is a taxi driver and helps cover the household expenses.  He feels he can balance both his obligations to the family and to re-building their home.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a cosmetics shop where she sells her goods to the general public. Rita lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She aspires to open a salon in the future, and she describes that her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food and school fees.  Her other sources of livelihood include earnings from the husband. With this KSH 20000 loan, she plans to purchase cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Felix Gerardo

texts.es:
Felix es un joven muy trabajador, es padre de un pequeño al cual quiere mucho y sobre todo por el que trabaja con tal de darle lo mejor y que sea feliz; su vivienda se encuentra en el distrito de Parcona, este distrito se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, así como también en el se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando Felix tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer un libro y también aprovecha la oportunidad para disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Día a Día Felix sale a trabajar en su negocio como carpintero, mayormente realiza trabajos de tapicería de sillas  y también arregla zapatos, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene mucha creatividad.

Felix está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar 
material para la realización de su trabajo como tela, cola, herramientas, clavos, esponja, entre otros, así el poder tener lo necesario para realizar su trabajo y así mismo seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder darle a su hijo una buena educación y ser feliz”.
texts.en:
Felix is a very hard working young man. He has one small son whom he loves very much and above all he is the reason he works hard, so that he can give him the best and so that he will be happy. His house is located in the district of Parcona; an area known for having a hot climate, and for being an area known for agriculture and livestock. During his free time Felix likes to read and to take advantage of the opportunity to enjoy one of his favorite Peruvian foods, Arroz con Pato (rice with duck). He was only able to study through junior high, but he would have liked to have studied law. 

Everyday Felix goes to work in his carpentry business. The majority of the jobs he has are upholstering chairs and also fixing shoes. He usually works around 10 hours a day and helps an average of 6 customers during this time. He believes his business is doing well because he is very nice to his customers and above all because he is creative.    

Felix is very thankful to the lenders on Kiva; thanks to the help they have given he will be able to buy materials to be able to do his work, like fabric, glue, tools, nails, sponge and other things. With these purchases he will be able to complete his work and continue working to make his biggest dream come true, to be able to give his son a good education and a happy life.

loans.use: to buy sponge, glue, nails, tools, fabric and other things.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for two years. She received a loan from her father to start the business.
She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase rice, detergents and cereals. She aspires to open other outlets in the near future and believes that the extra income obtained from this loan will help her educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice, detergents and cereals.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a mother of four children who are all in school. She is married to a business man and they live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For the last six years, Mishi has been operating a shop selling foodstuff to her neighbors. High transport cost and theft of goods are her major challenges. She dreams of expanding the shop to a wholesale business and hire employees.  

Mishi joined Yehu because of their good products. Other sources of her family's livelihood include earnings from her spouse. With this loan of KSH 50,000, she will be able to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to resell.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a mother married to a business man. She has four children who are in school. She has been selling clothes in a shop for the past four years, and she aims at opening a wholesale business in the future. Grace sells her clothes to the general public and describes seasonality to be her major challenge.  She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She spends most of her income on food, rent and school fees. Grace plans to use the loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, su hijo aun vive con ella tiene 19 años de edad y  estudian en la universidad. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio del cantón.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, así como también productos de bazar, de papelería y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende en su misma tienda, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y esposo le ayudan más que todo en las noches cuando están desocupados, ella lleva tres años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres, artículos de bazar, papelería y productos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años,  es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos instalo su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo con tienda.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nuevos Horizontes" (New Horizons) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Martha. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children, but one of them is deceased. Her other child, age 19, still lives with her and is a university student. Her husband works for the municipal government within the canton.

Martha has a general store in her home where she sells all types of basic necessity products. She also offers bazaar products, stationery, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories), which are also sold in her store. Martha works every day from 6am to 8pm, and sometimes much later. Her son and her husband help out mostly in the evenings when they are not busy. Martha has been in this business for three years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to restock her business. She will buy provisions, bazaar products, stationery, and Avon products. Martha has been with her Communal Bank for 12 years and also serves as the treasurer of her group. She enjoys being a member because the loans were responsible for establishing her business. Her goal is to continue growing her store.

loans.use: to buy provisions, bazaar products, stationery, and Avon products.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Este comité se llama” Espíritu Santo “están en el decimo segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y es por eso que son muy reconocidas en su barrio, su inspiración son sus familiares, es por ellos que siempre luchan y se esfuerzan.
Daisy es una de estas mujeres, ella con la ayuda de su grupo y también sumado a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Comenta que tiene una peluquería en la que atiene a todos sus clientes. Daisy se ha hecho de buena fama, ya que siempre da muy buena atención y tampoco es muy caro.
Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su peluquería y es por eso que pide un crédito a Kiva y a la fundación paraguaya, para la compra de spray, tijeras, juegos de peines, ruleros, tintes y otros, ya que estos son los productos que mas usa y le serán muy utiles.
texts.en:
This committee, called "Espíritu Santo" [Holy Spirit], is in the twelfth cycle of the Fundación Paraguaya program for women entrepreneurs.  The women are real fighters and because of this they are well known in their neighborhood.  Their inspiration is their families; it is for them that they always fight and put forth effort.  

Daisy is one of these women.  She, with the help of her group and also in addition to her own efforts, is flourishing.  She says that she has a salon in which she attends to all of her customers.  Daisy has made a good reputation for herself since she always gives close attention and is not very expensive.  

She wants to continue investing in her salon and it is for this reason that she asks Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to purchase [hair] spray, scissors, comb sets, curlers, dyes and other items since these are the most used products and they will be very helpful.

loans.use: to purchase [hair] spray, scissors, comb sets, curlers, dyes and other items.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo  es un hombre que tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Oswaldo vive en  el caserío CP-10, distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura, así mismo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Oswaldo es la crianza/venta de  aves de corral, caprinos, porcinos,ovinos; la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Oswaldo cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; el vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo  también se dedica a la agricultura como una actividad complementaria donde tiene instalado 0.5 ha, de limón donde viene cosechando semanalmente y esto le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales, su cónyuge también  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Oswaldo se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde y mantenimiento de su cultivo instalado, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a 40 year old man, he is married by common law, he has three dependent children, and he lives in his own home with his spouse and children.  It's important to highlight that the quality of life in his community is at the subsistence level.  The majority of the residents are independent workers that breed, raise and sell livestock, and some are additionally involved in agriculture.  Oswaldo lives in the neighborhood CP-10 in the district of Tambogrande, department of Piura, where the electrical and water services are provided through a communal pool. Therefore, all of the families there live in poor economic conditions.

Oswaldo raises and sells poultry, goats, pigs, and sheep.  He raises these animals in pens in the yard outside his home.
